Stayed here for a conference and good hotel. It's a little way from the McCormack centre but rooms were good, staff friendly and the exec lounge nice and roomy. A good business hotel and would recommend.
One of my favorites in Chicago and in the U.S. The side dishes at Mastro's are the best of any steakhouse, absolutely incredible! The service is top notch.

If you go to Chicago, for sure you will want to have a steak and Mastro's is one of the best I've had. The restaurant is pretty classy, the staff is very kind and the live music definitely adds a nice touch.
Best steak cooked to perfection. Wait staff was friendly and attentive. I would recommend this steak house to any one. Hadto wait at bar a llittle longer than I like.

column3: want a steak, this place is it.
column4: They offer the best and most tender steak I have ever had. Waiter was on the ball didn't want for anything. We were there with a party of ten with no lack of attention to anyone. Fantasic place. Great bar.

I ordered a special bottle of wine for friends celebrating a birthday. The staff delivered as promised and added a great big piece of decorated chocolate cake at the end of dinner. My friends report that the meal was supurb.
Food and service excellent. Very expensive menu. Entertainment. Have tables for one person party. Bathrooms are on the second floor makes it difficult if you have bad knees.
Great steak. Service was fast and the food very hot. It is a high end steakhouse so expect to pay more

At a great dinner at Mastros. Steak great. Drinks fit to order. Service was enjoyable. Great Bar atmosphere. Band was off the Wall great. Butter cake is not to be missed, but consumed. Giv this dining place a try, no disappointments!

column3: For the Steakhouse Lover in you!
column4: You can never be disappointed when eating here- They have a live singer and music. The food is pricey, but super delish! If its your birthday... or not... HAVE THE BUTTER CAKE. Its seriously the best thing I have ever eaten in my life!!!
Chicago has no shortage of great restaurants but save your time looking for the next best thing. This Mastro's gets it right every time! Nicely done.
Dined at Mastro's for two friends bday. The service, drinks, food and atmosphere were superb! This is by far my favorite restaurant.
The place is large and loud with live music. So even if you are in another part of the restaurant the noise level was for my taste too loud. The steak was excellent, so was the service.

I thought GIBSONS was good. Mastros has them topped. By a long shot. Get the off menu Waygu beef, shrimp cocktail and butter cake. Listen to the awesome band. Enjoy an amazing meal. Bring your credit card.
The lobster was great. The steak was great. The corn was great. The potatoes were great. The wine was great. The ambiance was great. But the butter cake...The butter cake was everything.
Great steak and the selection of seafood platter! Service was great and in fact, it's definately ranking top 3 in my list
Went there for appetizer and dessert. The atmosphere was very nice and the butter cake is the best out there. If you have not tried it, I would recommend that you do.

There is nothing I didn't like about this place. Service, staff, food all excellent! For those who have never been there, be advised it is quite pricey and if that's not an issue, then you have no issue with going to this place.
We enjoyed a great birthday meal here during our visit. It's your typical upscale steakhouse with great ambiance and food. A great place to celebrate something special!
Great variety of meat cuts, all well prepared (ate in group of 8). Good selection of sides and an extensive wine list.
Once our eyes adjusted to the dim lighting, we had a great dinner, probably the best steak I've ever had! It quite pricey but well worth it.
If you are looking for the best steakhouse look no further as Mastros is terrific. The food, service, and atmosphere are all top shelf. It doesn't get better than this.
While Chicago is known for great Steakhouses....This one rally takes the buttercake! I simply love the way Mastros prepares and serves up their delicious menu!
For a fine dining restaurant, I was impressed. The food was tasty and of adequate size. Dessert profiteroles was huge! Would defiantly return.

I ate here with colleagues after a meeting in June, 2014. I had the porterhouse steak with a side of mushrooms. The steak was outstanding with the right balance of juiciness and flavor. None of the odd flavor that some dry aged steaks have. Recommended.

Had my birthday dinner with friends here in mid September. Crazy good with excellent service. Sushi was excellent which surprised all of us at a steak place. Would go back here anytime I am I'm Chicago.

We had a party of about 40. They served delicious appetizers. They seated us in our private room and provided excellent service. Everyone raved of their excellent, tasty meal. The butter cake was to die for. Will go back.

We were there with a group in a private room. Everything was great...the steak, vegetables, wine and dessert. I was very impressed with the waitstaff...attentive without being in the way. A very nice evening.

Last week I organized the board dinner at the Maestro's. We had a private room and the service was outstanding and the food and wine excellent. The group really enjoyed the dinner. A big thank you to the team.
This restaurant has a very happening bar and very cool atmosphere, the food was very fair but I throughly enjoyed myself!
I recommend to sit in the lounge. The band is amazing, great atmosphere. Bone in filet is perfect, service great and wine list has excellent selections
Celebrated our 20th anniversary here!!! Amazing steak and service, had petite filet and hubby had special (Australian wage tomahawk), both were cooked perfectly. So good all around!! Enjoy!!
It was my first time here and I enjoyed it so much ! The food was amazing and so was the service! The martini on dry ice is awesome to! I will defiantly be back again :)

column3: If you can get past the hostess...
column4: The hostess was unfriendly and cold, but our server was top notch! Brian knew everything about the menu and everything about pairing wine with our meals. Wow!
mastros is always amazing. It doesn't matter if your in california, arizona, vegas , or Chicago. One thing you can count on is mastros always being the best in the city!
We live in Chicago and this is our favorite steakhouse among many. We love to pull up a seat at the bar for a meal if it is just the two of us. We usually split a steak. Also try a signature martini.

Unforgetable! We were celebrating a college graduation - the service and food made for an amazing evening! Our server Tony provided excellent guidance on the menu. Signature bone-in-filet was off the charts! Shellfish tower was easy to navigate and very fresh.... Entertainment was also enjoyable.
Had a great time, the drinks were strong and kept flowing, the appetizers were fresh and delicious. Kicking my self for not having dinner there.
We stopped in for dinner and music. Sat at the bar and were treated like queens. We had fabulous salads and cocktails. Music was amazing.

Wonderful dinner. We ate here when meeting some friends in Chicago. The steak was cooked to perfection. The garlic mashed potatoes were fantastic. The service was quite prompt and very attentive. All in all an excellent dining experience.
One of my favorite steakhouses in Chicago. The meeting rooms are perfect for business meetings and the food is fantastic. Highly recommended!!!

The steak was perfect, and huge! The lobster mashed potatoes were to die for and the bone marrow starter was out of this world! Service was also top notch and the Gal singing in the bar looked like a model. Great time all around!
I had an eighteen ounce bone-in filet. It was fantastic. Their king crab truffle gnocchis were also excellent. Wine list was good too, but has room for improvement.
Some of the best steaks in the city! Absolutely love mastros for any occasion and the service is amazing. Never had a bad meal there
Service is outstanding, and although I was with a large business group, I never felt like I waited too long for anything. Meal was memorable for quality of the steak.

We enjoyed this restaurant on an annual girls trip. The bar is very crowded and fun. Great cocktails and service. Fantastic food and large portions. Highly recommend sharing most entrees if you don't have a big appetite. Highly recommend! Reservations are a must!
This place is top of the line! I really enjoyed the great service, I felt like royalty. Food was out of this world! Steaks and seafood to die for! Butter cake is amazing!
In a city with so many excellent steak houses, Mastro's makes a great addition. The lamb dish is delicious - highly recommended.

column3: great atmosphere in the old style class of chicago
column4: Mastro's was the spot we chose for a private company party. It did not dissappoint. Excellent seafood and steak, fabulous bar, and fantastic wines. A small combo playing some cool tunes downstair. If this is a landmark in chicago I can see why.
It's avery nice restaurant, crowded and noisy. The food was very tasty and our server was nice. The menu is quite pricy but it was worth it since it was my birthday :)
Everything this restaurant serves is special - from the lobster bisque to the butter cake - just amazing. The live music was a fun treat. A little pricey, but worth it for a special occasion.

I have been to the Beverly Hills location on many occasions and always am impressed! My first visit to the Chicagi version and I loved it just as much. Steaks are always amazing and cooked perfectly. Service and deserts can never be beat.
The food cant be beat. Steaks awesome and the halibut was terrific. Had a side of Garlic mashed to compliment. Pretty expensive but it is worth it if you want great food.
I thought the Chicago Mastro's would not live up to the venues in Vegas and Scottsdale. I was WRONG....this big city Mastro's is fantastic and the butter pound cake may be even better.
A bit of a scene with low lighting. Nice decore. Good food. On a Wed night this restaurant was busy, which slowed the service. I like this place. Above average but not exceptional.

Service, steaks, seafood and sides ... you simply can't go wrong here. On my last visit, my wife and I shared a 33-ounce Australian wagyu steak and agreed it was among the best pieces of meat we've ever had.

I went there with 15 other friends to celebrate an event. The bar area is simply amazing with great live band playing. We all loved it so much. Dinner was very good as well. It is a must visit restaurant in Chicago. Simply great.

Was just ok. Server did not ck satisfaction with meal. Did not find steak particularly flavorful despite being touted as such. A similar experience to traditional steak - nothing too special. Nice bar. Priced like others
The steak is good, but not my favorite in the city. Still worth visiting. They have lobster mash potatoes and they are amazing. A little pricey, but still worth it.

I know there are a bunch of Mastro's in various states, but I really like this restaurant in Chicago most specifically. They did a great job on the build-out and the food and service are very good. Overall an excellent spot and I will return.
Went for my birthday dinner with friends. I had the bone-in ribeye and it was cooked perfectly. The lobster truffle gnocchi are fantastic and I was excited to see roasted brussel sprouts on the menu.
The service and food were exceptional. The stone crab claws and steaks were perfect, but it was rather expensive, even for a Chicago Steakhouse.
A very nice restaurant, I was there for a dinner and had the best sashimi tuna ever! It was really excellent, the meal... The place is nice, maybe a bit too dark but nice and elegant.

One of the best steak houses in chicago.. Great location,great setting, great food ... get the bone in ribeye , cowboy cut .... and for dessert you must, must, must get the buttercream cake, with strawberrys and whipcream...The food is expensive and worth every penny..
Veal chop was the best thing I've ever had. Cut it with my fork. The wifes filet was not far behind.
If you looking for a steak house in chicago, please go to mastro Steak house. you will love it. price is a bit high end compare other steak houses. but worth it.

column3: Great steaks and atmosphere, top tier service
column4: One of the best steaks I have ever had. I loved it and would go back anytime! Price is well worth it. The staff was constantly at our service for anything that we needed. Can't say enough... Really liked it!

column3: Good food, good atmosphere, but expensive
column4: Food was excellent and staff were very helpful. Prices are high. We had a group of 20 and the service was very well organized and attentive.

column3: great service, great food, book ahead.
column4: service was very good, with personable & attentive staff, and food was of high quality. Seafood was as good as any in Chicago, and steaks as good as Mortons and almost as good as Weber Grill's. Busy place though, so I'd say book ahead.

Second time here and it was perfect again. The meat is tasty and cooked perfectly the way you choose. The sides are amazing, specially the lobster mashed potatoes, and the butter cake is to die for. Don't miss going here!
good service and attention, nice decor (perhaps a tad too dark). great menu and high quality. While pricey - the portion sizes aren't dainty.

Absolutely fantastic steak, great bread, no complaints. Excellent service from Stephanie. Will definitely be back. Band in the lounge was loud, but REALLY GOOD. The after dinner mints were also great - Glacia mints from Italy.
A happening spot with live music, so noisy you have to yell in you partner's ear but great food and a place to be seen in Chicago! Dinner for 5 with drinks was $650

column3: Perfect for Entertaining a Group of People
column4: Entertained a Group of Clients at this restaurant. There were a total of 8 people. The service table side was outstanding. The food excellent. Extensive wine list as well.

column3: If you win lottery eat here
column4: Very costly.. All I can say it will be an expensive meal. If money is not the object try it. I do not have a business plastic card to use. So if you have to pay for meal go to Eire Cafe

The service was excellent, and the steak was amazing. I hate to say that a chain steakhouse is now my favorite in Chicago, but this was the best steak I have had, with fantastic service and a great table!
The meal was great! The porterhouse was cooked perfectly!
This rivals Mastros in Scottsdale. Fabulous. The Mac and cheesevwas to die for.

The steaks, specials, wait staff and wine list was outstanding. You cannot go wrong with any steak or meal you order. Sides are huge so plan to share. It is a little dark inside but it adds to the atmosphere. Would recommend it highly!
Great steak and sides. Would have gone for a 5, but atmosphere too dark to read the menu.
We love the bone-in ribeye!! Unreal steaks!! Great sides, awesome!!!
I would recommend this place to anyone looking for fine dining, good food and ambience!!! Love, love it!!!
Great steaks, wine, and the butter cake is something that cannot be passed up. Great service and great bar scene.
Very nice meal, huge portions. Nice splurge while visiting Chicago for college visits with son. Good bar scene and cocktails.

column3: great place for a night out with your family
column4: it's a bit pricey but the service and food was fantastic.
This place was hopping on a Monday late afternoon, during the holidays. We only had time for drinks since we had a dinner reservation at another nearby restaurant.

My husband and I visited Mastro‚Äôs (Chicago) with some friends on a Saturday in mid-February of 2011. Upon arrival, our car was promptly taken by valet and the hostess greeted us. We were a bit early, so she asked us if we would like to...More

I passed Mastro's regularly before they opened and had a friend in LA claim it was the best steak...so of course I had to get in and try it soon after they opened. Atmosphere was great - it has that dim light you find in any good traditional steakhouse. The tables were well spaced (now days a lot of restaurants have tables so close I can't tell who I'm sitting with). As for food, we started off with the oysters rock which was excellent, and one of the best wedge salads I've had. I'm a huge blue cheese fan, and went with bc dressing instead of their homemade. I did try this and would have enjoyed the wedge just as much with theirs...a creamy sort of thousand-island-like dressing, with what I guess was a red wine balsamic which gave it a really nice kick. Next was their signature bone-in filet and the king crab legs. Both were phenominal...the steak was exceptional - cooked perfectly on the inside, and had a nice crispy outside. Sides went with the lyonnaise potatoes, which were delicious, and the creamed spinach, which was equally as good. I wanted to try the gorgonzola mac, but wanted to be able to stand up after dinner - next time. We were going to throw in the towel but the server sold me on the butter cake, and man I'm glad she did. Clearly not healthy, but it was straight crack. The only change I guess I can suggest is the blue cheese stuffed olives were definitely bought pre-stuffed...makes for a better tini when they are stuffed on location with fresh blue.  Overall it was first-rate experience - I look forward to returning soon.
This place was hopping on a Monday late afternoon, during the holidays. We only had time for drinks since we had a dinner reservation at another nearby restaurant.

column3: Simply the Best Steak & Seafood Combo in Chicago
column4: So the rumor is that many restaurants haven't made it at this location. Mastro's will make it an make it big. In my book, Morton's nudges out Ruth's Chris and I would put the food, the service and the presentation at Mastro's (so the total experience) above Morton's, though Mastro's steakk finishes somewhere in between the two.  We visited on a Monday night and there were numerous people dining in both the upstairs and downstairs dining rooms as well as at the bar area, which is quite large.  The wine selection here is above average, but be prepared to spend big $$ on drinks and dinner. We shared a variety of red wines and the selection was generous without being overwhelming.  For our first course we ordered the custom seafood which was presented in a large community-style silver bowl. The crab legs, tuna and gigantic shrimp were served on ice with what appeared to be dry ice "smoking" from the center. Often, larger shrimp can be tasteless but this wasn't so at Mastro's.  Some in our party ordered seafood entrees and some ordered steak. All agreed it was fantastic. I had the bone-in ribeye and it was simply fantastic (it should be at $43). Presentation was perfect. The steak was cooked perfectly, slightly crusted on the outside, medium rare and melted in my mouth.  Our sides were asparagus, which was almost as good as the asparagus my wife cooks, and lobster mashed potatoes, which is definitely recommended. I'm not a dessert guy, but one in our party had a birthday and I was assured that everyone was in love with the bread pudding-type finale! Wish I would've tried the key lime pie but was sated and satisfied.  Spend the money. Go there on a special occasion. Impress a client. Make it Mastro's.

My husband and I visited Mastro‚Äôs (Chicago) with some friends on a Saturday in mid-February of 2011. Upon arrival, our car was promptly taken by valet and the hostess greeted us. We were a bit early, so she asked us if we would like to take our table right away or have a cocktail in the bar. We decided to have a drink in the bar first, which turned out to be a pleasant experience and a nice warm-up for dinner. The bar is dimly-lit, with a very cool backlit display of liquor bottles behind the bar, walls of wine and champagne, and the bartenders are very well-trained, efficient, and informative. It was busy, but not so busy that we could not find seats at the bar ‚Äì sort of the perfect amount of people. After a cocktail, we were taken up the red, winding staircase to our table. The room d√©cor is kind of ‚ÄúMad Men‚Äù, with ice blue silk curtains and contemporary modern chandeliers. It is elegant and chic, but still very comfortable. Our servers were upbeat, efficient, knowledgeable, and very on top of their game. Our table ordered 1 bone-in filet, 3 bone-in ribeyes (2 with extra seasoning), an order of black truffle gnocchi, gorgonzola mac‚Äôn‚Äôcheese, wasabi mashed potatoes, and a warm butter cake for dessert. All of the food was fabulous ‚Äì honestly, everything was sooooo good. The steaks were perfectly cooked and, of course, were the highlight of the meal. The glasses of wine were very generous. However, the black truffle gnocchi was a major highlight ‚Äì YUM! Dinner here is not cheap (plan for $100 per person, give or take), but this was the best overall dining experience that we have had in memory and we hope to return as often as possible. Thus, highly recommended!!!

I passed Mastro's regularly before they opened and had a friend in LA claim it was the best steak...so of course I had to get in and try it soon after they opened. Atmosphere was great - it has that dim light you find in any good traditional steakhouse. The tables were well spaced (now days a lot of restaurants have tables so close I can't tell who I'm sitting with). As for food, we started off with the oysters rock which was excellent, and one of the best wedge salads I've had. I'm a huge blue cheese fan, and went with bc dressing instead of their homemade. I did try this and would have enjoyed the wedge just as much with theirs...a creamy sort of thousand-island-like dressing, with what I guess was a red wine balsamic which gave it a really nice kick. Next was their signature bone-in filet and the king crab legs. Both were phenominal...the steak was exceptional - cooked perfectly on the inside, and had a nice crispy outside. Sides went with the lyonnaise potatoes, which were delicious, and the creamed spinach, which was equally as good. I wanted to try the gorgonzola mac, but wanted to be able to stand up after dinner - next time. We were going to throw in the towel but the server sold me on the butter cake, and man I'm glad she did. Clearly not healthy, but it was straight crack. The only change I guess I can suggest is the blue cheese stuffed olives were definitely bought pre-stuffed...makes for a better tini when they are stuffed on location with fresh blue.  Overall it was first-rate experience - I look forward to returning soon.
This place was hopping on a Monday late afternoon, during the holidays. We only had time for drinks since we had a dinner reservation at another nearby restaurant.

column3: Simply the Best Steak & Seafood Combo in Chicago
column4: So the rumor is that many restaurants haven't made it at this location. Mastro's will make it an make it big. In my book, Morton's nudges out Ruth's Chris and I would put the food, the service and the presentation at Mastro's (so the total experience) above Morton's, though Mastro's steakk finishes somewhere in between the two.  We visited on a Monday night and there were numerous people dining in both the upstairs and downstairs dining rooms as well as at the bar area, which is quite large.  The wine selection here is above average, but be prepared to spend big $$ on drinks and dinner. We shared a variety of red wines and the selection was generous without being overwhelming.  For our first course we ordered the custom seafood which was presented in a large community-style silver bowl. The crab legs, tuna and gigantic shrimp were served on ice with what appeared to be dry ice "smoking" from the center. Often, larger shrimp can be tasteless but this wasn't so at Mastro's.  Some in our party ordered seafood entrees and some ordered steak. All agreed it was fantastic. I had the bone-in ribeye and it was simply fantastic (it should be at $43). Presentation was perfect. The steak was cooked perfectly, slightly crusted on the outside, medium rare and melted in my mouth.  Our sides were asparagus, which was almost as good as the asparagus my wife cooks, and lobster mashed potatoes, which is definitely recommended. I'm not a dessert guy, but one in our party had a birthday and I was assured that everyone was in love with the bread pudding-type finale! Wish I would've tried the key lime pie but was sated and satisfied.  Spend the money. Go there on a special occasion. Impress a client. Make it Mastro's.

My husband and I visited Mastro‚Äôs (Chicago) with some friends on a Saturday in mid-February of 2011. Upon arrival, our car was promptly taken by valet and the hostess greeted us. We were a bit early, so she asked us if we would like to...More

I passed Mastro's regularly before they opened and had a friend in LA claim it was the best steak...so of course I had to get in and try it soon after they opened. Atmosphere was great - it has that dim light you find in any good traditional steakhouse. The tables were well spaced (now days a lot of restaurants have tables so close I can't tell who I'm sitting with). As for food, we started off with the oysters rock which was excellent, and one of the best wedge salads I've had. I'm a huge blue cheese fan, and went with bc dressing instead of their homemade. I did try this and would have enjoyed the wedge just as much with theirs...a creamy sort of thousand-island-like dressing, with what I guess was a red wine balsamic which gave it a really nice kick. Next was their signature bone-in filet and the king crab legs. Both were phenominal...the steak was exceptional - cooked perfectly on the inside, and had a nice crispy outside. Sides went with the lyonnaise potatoes, which were delicious, and the creamed spinach, which was equally as good. I wanted to try the gorgonzola mac, but wanted to be able to stand up after dinner - next time. We were going to throw in the towel but the server sold me on the butter cake, and man I'm glad she did. Clearly not healthy, but it was straight crack. The only change I guess I can suggest is the blue cheese stuffed olives were definitely bought pre-stuffed...makes for a better tini when they are stuffed on location with fresh blue.  Overall it was first-rate experience - I look forward to returning soon.
This place was hopping on a Monday late afternoon, during the holidays. We only had time for drinks since we had a dinner reservation at another nearby restaurant.

column3: Simply the Best Steak & Seafood Combo in Chicago
column4: So the rumor is that many restaurants haven't made it at this location. Mastro's will make it an make it big. In my book, Morton's nudges out Ruth's Chris and I would put the food, the service and the presentation at Mastro's (so the total experience) above Morton's, though Mastro's steakk finishes somewhere in between the two.  We visited on a Monday night and there were numerous people dining in both the upstairs and downstairs dining rooms as well as at the bar area, which is quite large.  The wine selection here is above average, but be prepared to spend big $$ on drinks and dinner. We shared a variety of red wines and the selection was generous without being overwhelming.  For our first course we ordered the custom seafood which was presented in a large community-style silver bowl. Some in our party ordered seafood entrees and some ordered steak. All agreed it was fantastic. I had the bone-in ribeye and it was simply fantastic (it should be at $43). Presentation was perfect. The steak was cooked perfectly, slightly crusted on the outside, medium rare and melted in my mouth.
