Had dinner on the patio overlooking the Chicago River last Friday night. Just amazing experience. So beautiful and the food was very good. Great service and I recommend this restaurant right on Michigan Avenue
Nice ambiance and great views along the Chicago River. Steaks were excellent, desserts were super sized. Service was great. Wonderful night.

column3: Slow service and they got my order wrong
column4: I ordered a filet mignon steak, well done. They cooked my friend's steak well done and mine medium rare. The service was very slow. The waitress often disappeared for long periods of time.
The view of the river is magnificent. The selection for steak or fish is very good, overall an enjopyable evening.
I enjoyed our stop here next to the river. It's a little dark, but with an old, up-scale feel. The food was good and our waiter was friendly.

The food was extremely overpriced ($60 dollar steaks.) The portions weren‚Äôt very large. Our waiter, although, was extremely kind and funny and attentive. The chocolate cake is HUMUNGOUS, so save room. Only decent for an expensive steak house.
One of the best hidden places in Chicago. Food was implacable and service is top notch. From simple seafood appetizer to exquisite dry aged steak. Downstairs Wollensky Grill is the place to be ....
Nice ambiance and good food. Angry shrimp, salad, and Lobster bisque didn‚Äôt disappoint. Beautiful venue for since day.
On the water, white linen tablecloths, fantastic steak, delicious wine. A classic elegant steakhouse. Our favorite and we have been to all of them in Chicago.

Nice restaurant with very good fillet minion and enough space for the side dishes. The restaurant is not far away from the centre of the city and all the staff is friendly and ready to fulfil all your requests. You have to pre-book as it...More

This was my first time visiting Smith & Wollensky. This restaurant is a Chicago icon and wanted to see for myself if it was due to its past success or if it was based on its day to day merits. The answer was simple: they take care of every single detail from an excellent service to their extraordinary food. Their wine list is impressive. We had a red from Napa called Quilt which proved to pair well with our steaks.

Let‚Äôs start with the positives:  Location - terrific Service - very good (friendly, helpful, and the right level of attentiveness) Linen tablecloths and napkins - tick Food - good.  On the less positive side: Medium rare does not mean medium (I note other reviewers have had similar issues).  I could cope with that if I were not paying $50 (¬£40) for a steak (with a little salad garnish). The prices here are astronomical. Paying $9 for some very average fries is almost insulting. Everything else is on a similarly overpriced scale. I wished I‚Äôd checked the menu before sitting down. I don‚Äôt mind paying good money for top quality but this was taking the proverbial...

column3: Amazing meal, best I've ever had hands down
column4: Jennifer waited on us like royalty in the lower level grill. We sat at a table next to the glass for a great view of the river traffic. The bone in Ribeye my wife had could be cut with a fork. The twin stuffed lobster tails we excellently prepared with a generous amount of crab meat stuffing. The wine list covered all the spectrum's of a diners needs. We had a 2015 Darioush Cabernet that was reasonably priced at $210.00. It was decanted and served in a great crystal decanter. This was not a stuffy place but the food was as if you were having dinner in the finest restaurant. Could not be happier with our experience.

column3: Wonderful location, great service, good food
column4: I took my father here for his 60th birthday. The server wished him a happy birthday and he was even given a birthday card from management. Was a very nice touch and thoughtful. I had the bone-in ribeye and my dad has the New York strip. We were both very pleased. Sides were a salad, asparagus and mac and cheese. All were above average. The restaurant also included a big piece of cake on the house! Additionally the location is perfect. Right on the Chicago River with city views. Highly recommend this place.

column3: Nice place for a relaxing dinner river front
column4: Nice place on the river, with an outdoor area, but the interior is also pleasant. As a starter always serve excellent brioche with butter, we have continued with the dry aged rib-eye, very good and cooked to perfection. The dessert is American format, so huge portions and very sweet. Bill isn't cheap at all but no different from other restaurants of this this chain. Pleasant and accurate service.

We went here after looking up good steak places in Chicago that weren't too far because it was wet and cold and this was just next to the Langham where we stayed  I'll break the review down into components  Service - 5/5; our waiter was friendly, knowledgable and helpful...the brioche starter that was free was delicious  Sides - 2/5....ok so the truffle mac n cheese was nice but not mind blowing, the whipped potato had enough pepper in it to initiate a coughing fit and was not enjoyable to eat at all and the sauteed spinach was inedible - the amount of garlic was so out of proportion we genuinely didn't and couldn't eat it  Steak - 4/5, it was a great steak and it was good well...I have had far better steak for far cheaper at Sydney fine dining restaurants and steakhouses  Will I go back - no

Food was fantastic, but the service was below average. Was seated and my napkin was missing and had to ask twice for one. Our server was distracted by a larger table but another server was observant and came to take our order. When our dinner was served our plates were dumped on our table, and desert our plates felt like they were thrown on the table. Food was great but would not go back for the price and below average service.

column3: Great place for dinner before a show
column4: We had the great pleasure of dining here before a show at The Chicago Theatre. The staff was very accommodating, friendly and unobtrusive. Our waiter made fantastic suggestions and made sure everything we ordered was perfect. The aged rib eye was perfectly cooked and incredible flavorful. My husband had a NY strip with Gorgonzola baked on which was an off menu item a,so cooked perfectly. My only regret is that we didn‚Äôt allow for enough time to have dessert!
On the water, white linen tablecloths, fantastic steak, delicious wine. A classic elegant steakhouse. Our favorite and we have been to all of them in Chicago.

column3: A great place for celebrations (or for a first time in Chicago dinner)
column4: The food is great (if you like meat, they have great cuts and know how to cook them to perfection). The location is great and we particularly liked the Chicago River views.
We ate here with our family group and had an excellent experience. The service would outstanding and the food was excellent, and not overpriced by Chicago standards.

Spent the afternoon watching basketball and grazing. Wonderful appetizers...highly recommend the bacon! Yum! Great cocktails and recommendations from the bartenders for us tourists. Great view of the river as well! We will go back!
Couldn't decide if the steak or the Mac & Cheese was the best. Either way...they were both delcious. Everything we tried was absoluetely delicious. Return with pleasure!

I visited Smith & Wollensky for lunch on Valentine‚Äôs Day. It has a great view of the river and the server was amazing. Her attention to detail and friendly service was appreciated. We will definitely go back again.
We ordered a 117 USD Porterhouse for 2 that came carbonized , bitter taste .. Lamb chops tasteless We should expect better food in such steakhouse.

column3: Of the S&W I‚Äôve visited not the best
column4: Service was ok, usually they have better service at S&W , food was ok, just a little slow between times.
Our waiter, Gerald, was amazing. He was very attentive and took time to help us pick great wines and amazing cuts of meat. We have one here in our hometown and will definitely be eating there soon!

Such a variety of tasty small bites! Loved the Mac'nCheese Truffles dish along with crab sliders and Wollensky sliders; but first the amazing Lobster corn dogs. What a strange and exceptional array of tastes and flavors.
This place is famous. Make sure to reserve or go late (after 8 pm). Good service and excellent food.
I enjoy my meal which was T-Bone Steak well-done. My boss ordered all the appetizers to go with our meals the drinks just right as well not enough stars for this place I kid you not.

Very happy this was one of the restaurants we chose during our 3-day Chicago get-away last October. Steak, lobster, salads and herbed rolls were all fabulous! Took our time here and enjoyed watching the tour boats go by on the river. Great service too.
Located on the river, two floor dinning. Wonderful old school bar, friendly service. The steaks - well, average... nothing made me say it‚Äôs a go to place...
Always great. Always reliable. What stood out to me this time was how good the crafter drinks where. They went down very nicely. The crab cakes are awesome and the steaks were awesome. Yum!
Excellent seafood starters and Filet Mignon main. Service functional with little finesse. Random restaurant layout.
Truly a tradition restaurant but... very classical dishes, the steak was good but not impressive, salads regular taste... great location, fat check
Great solo lunch but pricey to say the least and if you add a martini, even more expensive then the usual steak house in Chicago, but great food and fantastic service.

Great Service, Amazing Food & throughly recommend a visit to this restaurant!!! Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and very friendly to our party!! Looking forward to visiting the London restaurant (nr Covent Garden)!!
Steak was absolutely amazing. Sit by the river for a great view and wonderful experience. Will go back.
We booked in advanced and got a nice table over the river which was wonderful but I have to say that the food dissapointed me a bit. I expected more from this "classic". Not sure it is worth it.
Very good diner on the terrasse with view on the river. Perfect meat excellent wine. Expensive but really worth it!
Consider myself a big fan of Smith & Wollensky in midtown Manhattan, S&W here is lovely, ensure to get the outdoor seatings next to the river.
My brothers birthday my birthday my sister-in-law‚Äòs birthday my daughter‚Äòs birthday. We had a fantastic meal. Awesome salmon entr√©e. And even more awesome birthday finale

After arriving Chicago and walking around the city and taking in the sights we decided to have dinner at Smith & Wollensky. The night was beautiful so we ate outside. Food, service, and overall experience was great. Would definitely go back again.
Filet as always was delicious. Shared vegetables also good. Dessert could‚Äôve been better - coconut cake was lacking in coconut. Service was great.

Very Old School restaurant. Prices are high, even for Chicago. Comfortable and informal. Food is very good and service is excellent. Loved the Lobster Bisque and the Lobster tail. Just be prepared to pay a large bill.

Great Food# Great patio seating# Family Friendly# River North Area# Wollensky‚Äôs Grill is open later with a great bar menu# Very nice staff# Free Wifi available# A must dining spot when in Chicago! I recommend the Burrata salad & Ny Strip ! Amazing!

We went to Smith and Wollensky before attending the Grant Park Symphony. We were seated outside along the Chicago River. It was wonderful. Our steaks were done with perfection and we received a wonderful dessert. The service was excellent!
My wife and I had a romantic dinner here on a recent Chicago visit. Try the crab legs, already cracked. Excellent steaks,Great service.
Great location with great service and good quality food. We had the steak. It was a bit expensive but worth it. The cocktail menu is ok. A bit expensive but worth it.
Steak was very good, sides OK. Not enough ambiance for me. Tables were too close together and I got hit several time by people walking by.

The ambiance, service, and food here were as expected for a high end steak house. The best part of the experience was dining al fresco and watching the traffic on the river. Overall the experience was just ok.
Best meet in Chicago, excellent service, the waiter was great! Nice picture to enjoy We'll came back!

A great location. mid level puts you on the edge of the Chicago River looking straight down at the water below. The chef is well seasoned as judged by the lunch items we had. Quite late lunch and great service.
Always a great spot. Love having a drink either upstairs or down in the Grill Room. Now that the weather is getting nice it is great to sit outside.

Everything was so uncreadibly delicious, I just can recommend it. The appetizer was wonderful, the main course and dessert also. The stone crab was my favourite. The staff was very polite and helpful.
What a great place to have steaks. good cocktail in the beginning until we got a table. Very good steaks with the famous rosemary bunnies. the wine expensive but good. i will be back.
We go here for lunch quite a lot. The service is excellent and food very good. Sometimes going to a chain has it‚Äôs benefits. You know it will be a safe bet. This one the service is exceptional.
Group of us had dinner - Steaks, Veal Chops, Tartar...something for everyone - every member of the dinner party loved their food.
I truly believe the steaks at Texas Roadhouse are better with a third the price. The service was good and the location was unbeatable. For the price I expected so much more.

column3: Nice place, aged meat really good
column4: I really enjoyed the service and friendly staff. Good suggestions from our waiter for food and beverages. The aged meat is a must.
Early November snow closed the patio but inside was nice. We almost always stop in when staying downtown Chicago. Food is always good as is the service. We love the beef appetizer.

column3: Must have been an off night.
column4: Two of us ordered riib eye medium. Both of us got blood rare. Also ordered fois gras on the steak. It was served cold and congealed. Unfortunately a bad night.
This place is fantastic. Great food And staff. Location on the river is perfect to have a fine dining experience.

column3: Best lunch digs with a great view!
column4: We had the tuna tartare, calamari and lobster corn dog from the sociable menu which was ample for a light lunch and good recommendation from waiter to be paired with Chard or Sauvignon Blanc. Walking distance from our hotel. Great experience!

Can't go wrong with this place when picking a steak house. Good venue by the river. Usual menu with seafood towers and a variety of steaks cooked to perfection. Just watch the price of wines though. Still cheaper than NY
Great unexpected surprise. Right on the river. Plus their twice yearly wine special was the best deal EVER. Terrific servicjyst can't say enough highly reccomended

Great evening. Was able to dine outside and our server was brilliant. Order the coconut pie it taste like heaven your mouth. We ordered several drinks from the lemon twist to the dirty martini you couldn't go wrong.
Best steak ever...and I have had a lot of them... Perfect Dirty Martini as well. Lobster Mac is a must! Go hungry, leave stuffed!

Absolutely loved the setting of this restaurant overlooking the river. Food was really good, especially the seafood tower (shrimp, lobster, clams, oysters and crab legs). Oh, and the steak and lobster mac n' cheese were delicious.
My husband's favorite steak restaurant...and we have tried all in Chicago. Can request seating next to window overlooking river. Always fantastic.
This place is awesome. Expensive but great food, service and views. It was absolutely worth the little extra expense.
The smoke wings were over slathered in scorched sauce however the szechuan green beans and wedge salad were off the chain!
The steaks were out of this world and I can recommend the onion rings highly. Staff also very helpful and a very extensive wine list - overall definitely recommend for a special night out.
2nd time in Chicago and 2nd time back to S&W. Excellent food, service and views. Like steak and seafood? Check them out.

column3: Gorgeous views of the River Walk and Chicago River
column4: The ambiance here is great! Truffle mac and cheese is not to be missed. Fantastic views and great service. A fun dining experience!

column3: Nice lunch, great service and great view
column4: Yes its on the slightly expensive side but you get a great meal. The service is a bit formal but very good, the quality was excellent. Given a chance we would return. Thanks for a great lunch of crab cakes and the steak sandwich!
Awesome spot for food! Directly on the river, it's a great place to grab dinner or drinks. Highly recommend the mac $ cheese, meatball appetizer and the cup o' bacon.
Great atmosphere, patio dinning was lovely. Excellent service and food was delicious. Well be back for more

Great views from the Michigan lake (up and down!) gigantic oversized plates ! Starters, Main, all the way to the end of the menu. Avoid overdoing your order ! A must have carpaccio/tartare. The only downside, is that they tend to over salt, their dishes.
A beautiful evening dinner sitting in the outdoor patio area overlooking the water and marina was awesome. The service and food was wonderful - lamb, carpaccio, lobster mac & cheese.
Simply awesome! Great food, great view, great time! We went to get some good food and got a whole lot more - highly recommend!

Awesome place. Great steaks, we sat outside and had a beautiful view. Unpretentious servers and polite staff. We each had a glass of wine, shared a salad, appetizer, steak, and a side. With tip it came to $187.

column3: Great Steakhouse right on the River.
column4: I found this location better than the one in NYC. Service was excellent and the oysters and steak were delicious. Great place for dinner.

Its very well located at the riverfront in a very nice ambiance area. The steaks are wonderful and the service, especially by Taylor, are really fantastic. We really enjoyed our lunch here Highly recommended and much better than Mortons of Chicago

column3: Great Restaurant and even better steak
column4: I was lucky to get a table outside and a sunny afternoon with great weather.And enjoyed one of the best steaks I have ever eaten in my life
Very good meal. Very fancy places with prices to go along with it. But it was a great experience. Staff was informative and nice. Steak was really good.

Nice location overseeing the river. Quick and attentive service and delicious meat. Tender, cooked to what was required and very very tasty. Very good side dishes as well. Great quality that you pay for!

One of the best meals I've eaten in Chicago. From the huge seafood appetizer of jumbo, jumbo shrimp, oysters and crab to the steak, and dessert everything was so we done and presented. We will be back!
This place was so good I ate there twice on my trip. Both times I sat downstairs at the bar. Service was wonderful and food was amazing. The Steak Frites was my favorite. Highly recommend!
We had an incredible meal and outdoor seat as we enjoyed Easter Sunday at Smith and Wollensky's. The seafood tower was incredibly and the service was spot on. Can't wait to go back!
Beautiful outdoor seating area over looking the river. Pleasant wait staff. Cob salad was very good, enough for 2 people. Burger looked wonderful. Good Bloody Mary, they make their own mix.
Just a great restaurant full of character and history and the steak and seafood is superb. Overall experience is excellent from the door to the servers - really look after people well.
Great steak & view of the river. Fun environment. Try to sit downstairs because that has the best view of the boats.
We dined here with a large group. The staff was very attentive and did a great job. I had the fillet and it was fantastic!

We had lunch on Christmas day and the staff was more than accommodating . We had a window seat and a fantastic view of the river. We had dinner at the Weber Grill and the lunch at Smith and Wollensky was far suburb.
This place truly was a drop of heaven. They make better steak than me and that's saying something. Don't make the mistake I made and wait to go here. Just go.
Had lobster bisque delivered to our hotel because room service was "unavailable" - my husband pretty much drank it!
We had an excellent dinner in a private room. The staff was great. This was a family reunion with 14 people. Only complaint was that it took a long tome to order our meal.
I enjoyed the split pea soup and crab cake for lunch. It was pricey and the drinks were expensive, but it was delicious.

Were a party of three, Saturday night, table rather small. Service overall just average, waiters did not show much interest, no friendly smiles, no recommendations etc. Oysters were only just average too, lamb and veal chops were very good.
Was in town for the rugby match between Ireland and NZ and was here on the Friday. Top notch. Service excellent and the food delicious. Well worth a visit
This place is expensive but worth it. The service was fantastic and my husband and I both had the most delicious steaks. Great location and ambience too, definitely one to try.
Had dinner in Smith & Wollensky last night. As you may imagine, Chicago was pretty busy over the weekend, but they managed to look fter us very well. Service was excellent and staff very friendly

column3: Park at Marina Towers, Enjoy the Best Steakhouse in the city that overlooks the water and gorgeous skyline!
column4: Cannot go wrong with this Steakhouse. The Kitchen has something for everyone. I love the Steaksandwich with little crispy onions on top. My daughter ordered angry shrimp. Too hot for me, but delicious. Fabulous Oysters Rockefeller . Top notch.

With 3 friends we have visited this restaurant and it was delicious. Steaks were Perfect! I really love it. As starter I took oysters which were awsome. I do recommend this place. Prices for steaks around 50$.
Went for a business dinner. Attentive staff. Good steak and great crab cakes. Can recommend for business dinners. Would go back again if I was going out for steak.

Met some friends from out of town, and chose this restaurant to celebrate. We made a great choice. Our server, Juan, was excellent. His friendly demeanor and personal interaction added to a fantastic meal.
For a famous spot on the Chicago River I expected more. Food was very good but nothing exceptional here and the overall experience was kinda boring. I have had better service and food at Mastro's.
Thanks Steve. The blue mints are great. Loved the placeüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜ Will be back to Chicago, Smith & Wollensky's
fabulous place and nice dinner. Romantic and lovely place. where ever you go, this brand is always a pleasure. I will never forget this evening .
The food, service and atmosphere was perfect!!! This standout restaurant has a quality staff that compliments the delicious high quality food.
Wonderful restaurant with a beautiful view of the city. The service was fabulous and the food was extremely good. A great place to go for special occasions.
We decided to splurge after a day of walking the city and did not regret a single penny spent. Great steaks, fish, martini's, and service. WELL worth the stop. Sit outside, if weather permits.
Thank you David for excellent service. Wonderful meal and beautiful views. David you have a great sense of humor.

Have visited S&W in New York and Boston and sorry to say that Chicago's is my least favourite.....no atmosphere, soup was luke warm, waiting staff although attentive went over board with everything being "awesome ", T bone steak and lamb chops were good.....but overpriced.
Excellent service and food. Black Angus bone-in filet was very tasty. Sides are also very good, specially the asparagus & lemon and the creamy corn with cheese.
This place has the most tender (although pricey) steaks in town. If you have a large party the private room can get quite hot and a little cramped. Service is excellent.

column3: Old school steak house with a killer river view
column4: Not modern, but I am glad it wasn't. I like eating at a classic place. We sat on the patio next to the river. Order the steak-I can say any more than that. The service is outstanding
I was in Chicago for business and we stopped by for dinner. We ate at the bar and the staff there was outstanding. Ordered the bone-in dye aged ribeye and it was awesome! We'll definately go back.
Great river location, steaks good as always. Very large portions so don't eat much beforehand to do it justice. Expect to pay for the quality
Was there in Fed 2016, was my wife 1st time in the USA. she loved the food and and staff. We are moving to Chicago later this year and look forward to eating there again

A lovely dinner with friends and family, we were seated on the terrace overlooking the river. The service was attentive but not intrusive. The fillet was delicious and enormous! So unfortunately too full for dessert. Excellent wine list. Thank you for a lovely evening.

So everything was excellent, service great, the steaks were perfect, the shrimp cocktail and horseradish were very good. Excellent wine selection! And the coconut cake if you get nothing else get the coconut cake delicious!!!!
Crabcakes and steaks were delicious. Service was terrific. We sat outside on a beautiful evening. It was perfect.

column3: Well worth a visit or two
column4: Excellent food, location, atmosphere and service. Our server was less than great, but he appeared to be an anomaly. Overall, most excellent.

column3: Great evening with a large party
column4: Extremely professional service and wonderful food and drinks. Our party had over 12 people, but we were well taken care of the entire time. The waiter gave great recommendations. The gorgonzola cheese dip was rich and delicious.
Nice view. Excellent service and delicious food and wine. A bit pricey like you would expect from a high quality place.

Amazing service. You were a party of 19 people and the service was outstanding. The steaks were second to none. It is safe to budget a little over $100 per person. I definitely will host another dinner there on my next trip to Chicago.
We sat outside right next to the River. The service was fabulous and the food fantastic. We celebrated our 27th anniversary in style!

column3: Great steak and view of the River
column4: A great meal of filet migon, mashed potatoes and Mac and cheese. Outstanding taste and very tender filet. Service was good. A little expensive but the view was worth it

column3: Still one of the best steakhouses in town
column4: On the lakeshore with a nice view on the city. I had a very tasty ribeye with good sides. Kind service. Absolutely nice dinner, maybe not the cheapest.
A+ service! Fantastic food! I had the Filet Mignon it was melt in your mouth tender and delicious! Put Smith & Wollensky on your must see list of Chicago restaurants!
We had a delicious starter with clamps, oyster and king prawns. The steaks were fantastic, the total experience would have been a 5'er with just a bit more keen waiters.
Of course the steaks are large, and they are tasty. The meal started with a fantastic bread roll to share. The steaks were cooked to perfection. We didn't have much room for dessert!

Searching for a dinner with acceptable food, we found this restaurant, good position on river and skyline. We had green salad , fried potatoes and rib eye steak. Good service, expensive like in Chicago standard. Without strange things and without strange taste. We appreciate it.

As someone that enjoys steaks, this restaurant is one of my favorites. Customer service is great. Although the Cole slaw salad is not offered in the menu, the waiter brought me one. Great place to celebrate an special date also.
Didn't actually eat there. They put us off so much just seating us that we left and found a better steakhouse.
Some of the best dream ever and cooked to perfection. The staff is helpful and attentive. Ask for downstairs window table- cannot be beat! You get what you pay for here.
Our server was great, new the wine selections very well, gave us plenty of personal time which is sometimes nice.
Upper floor was closed due to renovation. River view was perfect. Food was great as always. The bar in the middle is well located.

Table of ten during restaurant week with prix fixe menu. Good options. The filet was definitely better than the ribeye. Mashed potatoes were meh. Service was perfect. Attentive but not too. Bartenders were excellent too.

column3: Still a great meal and dining experience
column4: Top of the line steakhouse. Excellent service. Large servings. Steak and Salmon was excellent. Not dining outside.a bummer but will come back in summer.

We enjoy Smith & Wollensky for lunch. The steak frites is wonderful and get a side of their Mac and cheese. Service is always impeccable and the wine list is lengthy. Great ambiance and perfect for a business lunch.
I love steak and resist going to steak houses because frequently the steak is over/underdone (The Palm). Every time I eat at S & W the meal is perfect.

Had a late lunch today here- first visit. Definitely a repeat. The service was top notch, the atmosphere was very pleasing and food was delicious. Try the crab cake and the shrimp cocktail. The crab was the best ever. Nice job
Always enjoy Smith & Wollensky. That seafood app tower is great! The steaks always perfect. The staff is professional and knowledgeable. Great for business meetings

Enjoyed a couple of oysters and a steak topped with Gorgonzola with truffled macaroni as side dish. Oysters and steak were excellent. The macaroni was average - way too much cream. Service was truly excellent. A bit pricey though. Be prepared.
This is an excellent restaurant. Big platter of fresh seafood and excellent steak. Will come again when in Chicago. The restaurant is by the river so really nice views from where we sat.

column3: If steak would be a religion
column4: This would be its cathedral. Quite catchy advertisement. But it is true. The steak is really really good. The same is true for the wine selection. A good sommelier, nice atmosphere. You have to pay for it. But it is worth it.
Good quality and service but little pricy. They have a good selection of wines and you have to try the carrot pie!

I wanted to splurge on a fancy steak dinner. They didn't disappoint. My table was kinda in the corner but had great view of whole restaurant. Wine menu is extensive. They know beef. Ask for a table with a river view...I wish I had!

column3: Lovely service, very good food, fun view
column4: I enjoyed a terrific Lobster BLT and glass of wine at lunch yesterday. Solo dining is very comfortable here, I sat outside and watched the Columbus Day parade from across the river. Service was outstanding, dedicated and discreet.
One of the best restaurants in Chicago; perfectly done steaks every time, and service is always top-notch. This is a can't-miss experience for steak lovers. Outstanding wine program as well.

We are from New York and wouldn't have ordinarily considered this tourist place but the location overlooking the river is superb. The meat and seafood was high quality and well cooked served cheerfully. A destination restaurant worth visiting.
If steak is what your looking for, the ultimate steak is what your going to get. The house special porterhouse melts in your mouth....end of story. Staff was personable, place was clean.
The restaurant did not have a variety for everybody on the menu.The price i thought was very expensive in relation to the quality of food provided .
Lovely meal here on the River - so location is great. We had shrimp cocktail, WONDERFUL pea soup - and I do not usually care for pea soup. It has a wine list & professional wait staff
This restaurant is very impressive. The views of the Chicago River are amazing. The staff is top notch and the food was incredible. Highly recommend.
I enjoyed an excellent meal here along with excellent service. Good variety on the wine list. All the food was delicious. Highly recommend for a special night out.

column3: Great Place at a High Price
column4: Atmosphere and food is great. Staff is friendly and many choices for appetizers and entrees. It is pricey but a much better experience than some traditional Chicago steak restaurants.

We walked by Smith & Wollensky and thought it looked great, river location and all. Thought we did not have a chance for a table and VIOLA! got one right on the Chicago River. Delightful evening, Great Food and Service and Good Value. Thank you!
Quality food, service impecable and staff very courteous, i will definetely be back to one of these restaurants, it worth it!!

A good steakhouse, literally on the river. Dine in the dining room and you'll be overlooking the river. Very nice on a sunny day for lunch. Good food, good service, good wine and great desserts. Not the least the chocolate cake - its massive.
is just that GIANT. We ordered two desserts and really wish the waiter would have warned us that the Chocolate cake was larger than most cakes. Coconut cake was awesome!
I was taken to this restaurant by my Vendor while attending a trade show. The food was prepared perfectly and the Waite staff was on top of their game. What a nice experience in a great City.
One of the very best. Superb beef plus a delicious creamed spinach! On the river with great ambiance and very good service. Plenty of choices and great bar! Must go while in Chicago.
Nice place with great view and nice atmosphere. Steaks and sides were good but not excellent. Good service although the restaurant was fully booked.
Loved the Meal. The Pea soup is a must to try. Portions are enormous. Very nice service. Recommended Wine was very good.

The staff and service in this restaurant was excellent. Our server was very knowledgeable and pleasant and also the manager was very welcoming. The food was good but not good enough to warrant the price charged. I felt it was a bit expensive.
Serving staff is very attentive and of course the kitchen is one of the finest in U.S. The wine list included also Gew√ºrtztraminer.

column3: great steak house with a great history
column4: Been here several times over the years. the history brings me back. Always high quality. Remarkable amount of character - great stories when you find someone who has them.

Had a lovely dinner, table overlooked the river in the Grill portion of the restaurant. Menu was similar to main menu so that was not a problem. Ordered WAY too much food - everything was delicious. HIghly recommend the jumbo shrimp !
The smoked RIBEYE was soooo good. Everything we had was perfect. Nice restaurant with great wait staff. It is a little pricey for me but it was great.
The restaurant very intimate. The steak was fabulous, dry aged bone in ribeye. Mac and cheese truffle great side and butternut squash soup was superb.
I love Smith and Wollensky! Th sides are great and the beef is always top notch. I wish I didn't get the all day smoked rib eye special. The smokey taste was a bit too much. Next time I will know.

They age and cut their own Prime Beef here, so you can get some rare cuts, such as bone in Fillet, Porterhouse, and Sirloin! Great steak, very good service, nice ambiance. It was my wife's birthday, so they brought out a nice complimentary dessert!

Nice place to dine and enjoy the view of the river (if you get a table with a river view). Staff is very attentive. The food we order seemed salty. Next time I will let my server I have special dietary needs.
Steaks were very good. Good choice of wine. Waiter was a bit slow - we still had to tip the customary 18pc but then maybe we caught him on a extremely busy night.
The food is always fine here. The rosemary bread is marvelous. We hade burger and a Cesar salad. I do think that the staff think a little bit to much of them self!
We almost always go here for a meal when we come to town. I love the filet mignon oscar. We are never disapointed when wego here for lunch and/or dinner.
Do not go here if you are on a budget, but the food is very good the service was great and the drinks were poured very well... but you are looking at 150.00 to 250.00 per person to eat here.

column3: Poor service, particularly at the price.
column4: Though I ordered my steak "medium" it was dished nearly raw inside and still cool to the touch. The staff seemed more interested in hustling me in and out. Not a single smile or thank-you.

Visited for business with a large group. Beautiful location in downtown Chicago. Had the Lettuce Wedge and 24 oz signature ribeye. Very good food. The restaurant was packed and our service was very good. Really enjoyable Chicago Restaurant experience.

Great food and worth the money. The service is slow and they don't seem to care. We waited about 1 hour for our meal due to the slow service. At that time the restaurant was not busy and it was lunch time.

column3: A lot of food but very tasty
column4: Go for the Surf & Turf - excellent. Comes with a fillet and Lobster Tail. The Californian Voignier is also excellent and reasonably priced.
Great seafood !! Wonderful oysters!! A classic!! Love the decor and everything about it!! Always come here and it is always great!!
Cajun blue cheese burger juicy nd delicious. Lobster mango salad was amazing as well. Service was very good and quick considering it was happy hour, we ate in the bar area.

We loved the location, the service, the food & the overall experience! The Rib Eye Carpaccio appetizer was a favorite as well as the Truffled Macaroni & Cheese‚Ä¶my mouth is watering just thinking of it!
Every time I go to Chicago I go there. the food is excellent and the view is gorgeous. I went for lunch and service could have been a little more attentive but the overall experience was great.
When in Chicago you have to try a steak from the original - and best - steakhouse! It seemed preposterous at first. Who could eat that big a steak (24 oz). The answer? Me!
nice selection of wines on sale, we loved it all, great service, great view of the river. The smell in the room from all the food being served will drive you crazy in a good way :)
S&W did not disappoint! We went here with a group for work. The staff was warm and welcoming. The food was good and everyone enjoyed themselves.
I was able to eat here for a group business dinner. the service was excellent along with the food. everyone seemed to enjoy themselves. I recommend a stop here on the Chicago river.

Warm pub style dining... Classic Atmosphere... Looking out on the water... We ordered the Aged Rib Eye for hubby and I enjoyed the Halibut... everything was very delish! We finished it off w their Choc Hazelnut Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e! Yummm! Your constant companion, ~deirdra

We only had drinks here but it was a great place to sit and watch the world go by and on the river too. Bar staff were excellent and very friendly. Drinks were good prices considering where you are sitting.

Great views of the river, and of course great food. The food was on the pricey side, but worth every penny. My steak was perfect, and the wait staff is excellent. Highly recommend. Sit outside overlooking the river or downstairs with a river view.

For a good steak, a fantastic burger, you're in the right place. Been there several times during last years, this place never disappointed us. Quality is good and staff more kind and attentive than othe S&W in Boston and NYC.
Had an excellent filet, cooked exactly to order -- medium rare plus. Margaritas were well made. Cocktail shrimp were enormous. Overall very good meal.
Steaks are always excellent. For lunch, try their steal salad. Service is always good. Nice view of the Chicago River and great people-watching inside.
It was nice enough out to be able to sit outside and enjoy the views. Service was excellent, and the lobster BLT was delicious. The prices are high, but the view is worth it.
Excellent service, excellent food, a cool breeze off of the Chicago river as twilight settled upon the diners. Great drinks too. What's not to like. Oh,walking distance to most downtown hotels.

column3: NOT BIG ON RED MEAT BUT...
column4: Best steak to ever touch these lips! Hands down a great steak makes all things better! The chipotle steak is to die for!!!
Ran in just before close after a long day at work. Had a fine burger at the bar. Service was great, price was steep for just a burger -- but I enjoyed it anyway.
Steak was over cooked and gristly; average service. In a city of fine steakhouses, this place is at the very bottom.
The place is very good and the atmosphere is great, but the prices are quite expensive to eat a regular piece of meat.

I have been in several restaurants of Smith & Wollenski, the food is always great. The atmosphere in this Chicago restaurant was average, in NY it is much nicer...Location however is excellent with nice river views
so the cacun steak is to dies for . white linen and very professional service staff ,make the night . The place gets real busy after work so make a reso .
We had a wonderful dinner that was delicious and the service was superb. The waiters were friendly, courteous and the view of the Chicago River was great.
we all started with the seafood appetizer which had shrimp, crab, lobster, clams, oysters and more. Most excellent. Went with the most wonderful bone in ribeye. I still dream of it.
I've had the privilege of dining here twice, both times were wonderful. The setting is beautiful, the service is outstanding and the food is succulent! Steaks were cooked to perfection.
Dinner out with some girlfriends. Service was great. Food was excellent. Steak cooked to perfection. Pricey but we felt it was worth it. Would definitely go back.

Their bone-in rib-eye is the best I've ever had! Their filet mignon is up there too. Great place - steaks are unbelievably good, and the sides are delicious as well. Be ready to spend a bit though, as this place is slightly pricey.
The steak was perfectly prepared. Our waiter treated us as though we were "regulars". Very friendly and knowledgeable. We will definately dine here again!
Simply excellent food service and friendly stall... Ask for the tour. It's interesting history !,, check it out. ;)
Casual fine dining at its best - laid back, yet sophisticated! Excellent food and good service! Beautiful view of the river as well.
Excellent steak and sides. Place and services are very good, but I have the feeling that it s a bit overrated or overpriced.
Colorado ribeye, mushrooms and new side of root veg in duck fat with a nice glass of cab hits the spot everytime. The team in Chitown makes you feel at home.

Had high expectations and the price met that. Very high. Outstanding view. The filet was average at best. Mushroom soup very good. Salad very good. Green beans very good. Service excellent. Chocolate cake was very disappointing. Much better steak houses to go to!

One of my go to steak houses in Chicago. The crust on my filet was perfect and flavorful, not like so many other filets that have not crust. Lobster bisque was fine, but could have benefited from a bit of sweet sherry.
Nothing here really blew me away. Steak and foie gras were cooked fine. And the service was kind and prompt.

column3: Good Steak House in Chicago and great location
column4: Enjoyed a dinner here with colleagues. The steak was fantastic and the bernaise sauce was lovely. Salad was fresh and yummy, too. Definitely a classic style steak house in a great Chicago location. Great service and happening place. Worth a visit in The Windy City.

Wanted to eat near the river. The 1 order of fillet and shrimp was enough for 2 people. The wait staff was great and also appreciated their wine recommendation. Spulrged on the chocalate cake which we took home -it was Huge!

We went there by recommendation from very good friends and we weren't dissapointed. Accordin to my wife she had the best tuna steak ever and my sirloin was also excellent. We sat on the terrace overlooking Chicago river and the waitress was very charming.
Sat down at 8 and still no food an hour and a half later. Not what you would expect considering the size of the restaurant . Begs the question - how many chefs???
group business lunch, prix fixe. I had the burger, still full the next day. comes with slaw and fries. the cheesecake was great. service was great. nice river view. smooth service.
Ate overlooking the river on a balmy night. Had a few appetizers as it was late. Everything was so delicious. Very pricey but great!

A great taste of Chicago!. Steaks are huge and charred to perfection. Sides are enough for 2 or 3. Desserts are large enough for your table and the one next to yo.Service is excellent. Asked to be seated on the main level ,
We eat here often, and it's typically good but my husband said his fish n chips was not right, and he felt I'll the next day. Unusual.

column3: Good meal, good service, no bargain...
column4: Very good steaks and scallops. Very professional wait staff. Strong martinis, and good wine list by the glass. Not a bargain, however, so be prepared...
Had the steak, of course! They offer a 5 oz. as add on to a salad, great idea for the gluten Free. The 10 oz. is huge for the slim and trim, eh! Cheers Alex
Cooked perfectly. Great view on a Spring afternoon with a cool breeze sitting on the patio and an all around pleasant experience.
What I remember as much as the delicious meal, were the views, over looking the water taxis and chicago riverfront. Such a great experience!
I had lobster bisque , bread and fresh brewed ice tea ... Everything was great !! Place is beautiful !! Nice view , friendly staff .. Great place to go would return :)
Yes, the prices are high, but the food and service were excellent. The wait staff make you feel comfortable and I loved when they deshelled the lobster. Awesome!
Just a fantastic lunch: fillet mignon and lobster both delicious as was the carpaccio and my bespoke crab / shrimp appetiser. Good old fashioned service, great martins, wines: loved the lunch.
My 20+ time , one of the best dry aged stakes + very good service, + direct window on the chicaago river. But rather expensive.
Great place. The steaks are wonderful but not cheap. Friendly staff and atmosphere. Location is great not far from the theater district.
I've never had a bad meal at S&W, and now they have tents for dining along the river - magnifico. Reservations recommended.

several colleagues and me visited the restaurant and everything was great, the Chicago River great view, if you order the Shellfish Bouquet you wont be dissapointed for sure. A little noisy because it was packed.

column3: Best steak in town, excellent service
column4: Very nice restaurant by the water, downtown Chicago. Great view, amazing steaks and excellent service. A bit pricey, but worth it!
I went here for an IT storage seminar back in the fall of 2012. This place is phenomenal. The service is excellent, the food was top notch, great view of the Chicago River; no complaints!
From the bread to the dessert everything was fantastic. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. It overlooks the river. The service was outstanding. I just can not stay enough about this restaurant.

column3: Best steak and view in the city
column4: I do love S & W and this location is no exception. Friendly wait staff and manager, neat view of the river and the food is cooked to perfection. Too bad there was no lobster mac and cheese on the current menu!
We found this restaurant because of its proximity to the Goodman Theatre. The food is good, but eating outside along the river is sublime.

Best Steaks in town. The service was awesome. The food is always plentiful and within our budget. No matter where else we go to eat, we end up back at Smith & Wollensky's realizing we should always come here first.
I bravely departed from the beef selections and ordered the (full) rack of lamb. Excellent. My husband ordered the ribeye and, as always, was not disappointed.
Start with "The Colonel" cocktail if you like "brown" liquer! Steaks are large, tasty and pricey. This is an upscale place with great food and top notch service.

Best dinner experience ive had in chicago! Great service by everyone that worked there..even went to bathroom and came back to napkin refolded. Amazing filet. Every detail perfectly watched. Meet my future father in law for the first time and was an unforgetable experience
Went to Smith's to grab crab salad & steaks. Service, wine selection food are always very good and consistent quality.

Four of us attended dinner while the food was good, the wine tasty, the lower level seating is very noisy when full. A window view of the Chicago River is a nice touch. Be prepared to spend a few dollars.

The food here is amazing and the servers are so knowledgeable they really enhance the entire experience. Bring your appetite to this one. I was a guest in a party of 12, but I would go there for a special occasion on my own.
The view is amazing and overlooks the water. Steak and side dishes were tasty. The service was fantastic and we were very impressed.
Food and service was good, steak was good. But that was just it, for the price for 2 dinners of $200 it was just good.
The food just isn't interesting and the portions are small. And the prices are high. A chain restaurant.
Excellent views and great food!! Noit a better steak in Chicago!! Great sides and drinks as well. We sat outside and enjoyed a crisp evening overlooking the river! Service was attentive as well!
A great view from the deck at this branch of the classic NYC Steakhouse. Friendly service, excellent food, and good drink. Worth the trip
Great service from the minute we walked in. Food was fabulous. I'm surprised that they don't have a better rating in Chicago.
Sitting outside overlooking the river. Great steak with shrimp - yummy! Price is a little high - $80 dinner, but it is Chicago .....
I love a view & the riverside view is great. Food also very good - 6 shooter looked terrific, steak & seafood were terrific. Get the 3 salmon sampler!
Indoor and outdoor seating on the river just North of the Loop. Great Steaks done perfectly. Too much to eat. I go once a year when in Chicago on business

I dined here several years ago. I love the ambiance and the outdoor river walk seating. The outdoor river walk area is the best place to dine in the summer. The views of the Chicago River while eating with that special someone is very romantic.
We stopped during our sight seeing and got a little bite to eat. I just had the Pizza and it was very good. service was good and the ambiance was great.
We go here for the creamed spinach always. Good steaks and the outside dining along the river is perfect. Fun traditional steakhouse staff.
There are much better steak or seafood restaurants in Chicago. This is a "name droppers" restaurant.

One of the best meals of my life.. The bone in ribeye was decadent. The green goddess dressing was just superb!! This was a real treat and a amazing was to celebrate our anniversary. They got it right!!!
This company / restaurant does not understand customer service. Food wasnt so great either.

One of the best meals I have ever had, thank god I didn't have to pay though. Pricey but delicious. If you can save room for the amazing desserts. Also, when the weather is warm you can sit right on the Chicago River. $$$$

I go there for the cajun rib-eye...they tell me it was invented by chef in Chicago.Its a chain but a wonderful chain(I have eaten in NY many times).Everything is ala-cart.Each sidedish is enough for two so don't go overboard.First Class!
We ate in the room next to the kitchen. Glass windows over looking the kitchen. Really quite special. If you can't get a window seating, this is a great alternative.
We went for wine week and the wines were wonderful and the food is getting much better but it is still just average, last wine week it was BELOW average at best so it is getting better.

column3: Go for the bone in fillet
column4: Absolutely fabulous food, service and view. I ordered the bone in fillet and was not disappointed. Perfectly cooked. great flavor. Mouth is still watering. Finished with the warm butter cake. Well worth it.
Fabulous!!! Great table over looking the river, great food, great atmosphere, great everything!
You have to go to these restaurant without a hurry, give yourself thetime to apriciate the real deal , these guy in chicago are really good,

There are a lot of great steak houses in Chicago, but non of them are right on the river, with outside seating available for those gorgeous day of summer. I also recommend the chocolate cake to share, as it is huge....but sooooooooo good!

column3: High-End, More than Just a Steak House
column4: Known for steak, but steak is not only thing to come here for. If you want an experience with steak that has the extra something special, come here.
The best steak house in Chicago! Overlooks Chicago River - great location to

Great service. Didn't have a reservation but they found a table at 7 pm on a Saturday naight. Great steaks....much better than Chicago Chop House...and the service could not have been better....just outstanding service. A bit pricey but worth it!

column3: Great location, but not as good as its NY and Miami restaurants
column4: Nice place, good location on the Chicago River--which view only works in the day time and if you sit on the terrace. Service is perfunctory, wine list mediocre, and the steaks and side dishes are average, and not as good as the S&W in NYC.

column3: A great steak house with an updated Chicago ambiance!
column4: Plenty of steak house options (try the bone-in filet), a great wine list, solid service, massive desserts served in an energetic atmosphere. Bring your piggy bank!

column3: Like meat and good food. Eat here in Chicago
column4: Ate in the grill. Had a burger and girlfriend had a steak. It was her first time here and she loved it. Wish they had a more extensive wine list..other than that was great. Great service. The manager checked on us twice. Nice guy!
These guys really live up to their reputation, although the crab & lobster we had at the table was first rate. Its an easy walk from our spot at the Trump Towers too.

column3: Busy but always a sure bet for steaks
column4: Centrally located, this spot sees plenty of professionals enjoying a hearty dinner. The ambience is elegant and sophisticated, the food impeccably cooked and presented, the service attend and unobtrusive. Steaks are of outstanding quality. Cost is adequate to the high level of the restaurant.
Great service and food. Loved the split peasoup and the marinated cajun rib-eye was spicy to my liking.
Impressive menu-great place for a romantic date or for impressing a client. On the experience side
Also love the happy hour, it's perfect for an early dinner with your sweetie and a cocktail.
The view was great but the food just okay. Go there and behind the Restaurant is the bar along the Causeway. It's a great place to go around 4 PM when the ships leave the port.
Enough said. Prices reflect 80% pretention, 20% food
Love this restaurant, the creamed spinach is to die for. Love this place because its in a great location and has great food.
This place is definately on the high end for price, but the service and food were fantastic.
Went for lunch while visiting Chicago. Not very impressed by either the food or service. Expected more having visited the Miami restaurant...
Seafood fountain good for 4 people.....be careful not to have so much, so you can enjoy the main course.
There are so many steakhouses in Chicago, this was not the best choice. The service was just ok, and the food itself was average. Will go to Mastro's or Joe's the next time instead.
nothing like sitting in the bar on a nice saturday

We had a party of ten. Most had steak or seafood; one person order lamb. We all loved our meals. The seafood appetizer was great and easily served four or five people. The price was also very good when compared to similar high end steakhouses.
Their agied steak is one of the best.

column3: Try the Filet Oscar. Filet Mignon topped with crab and hollindaise sauce. Yum, yum. They age the beef themselves.
column4: Try the Filet Oscar. Filet Mignon topped with crab and hollindaise sauce. Yum, yum. They age the beef themselves.

column3: Great steak house! I believe Shelby Morrison likes to make appearances here while in town working at Merchandise...
column4: Great steak house! I believe Shelby Morrison likes to make appearances here while in town working at Merchandise Mart...

column3: Exactly what it should be. Good, classic food. And the river views are incredible! I had a birthday card sitting on the...
column4: Exactly what it should be. Good, classic food. And the river views are incredible! I had a birthday card sitting on the table waiting for me when I arrived, and they brought out an ice cream cake for dessert on the house!
crispy pork shoulder..mmmmm

column3: Good steaks and great service. Nice atmosphere. Not too noisy.
column4: Good steaks and great service. Nice atmosphere. Not too noisy.
High end chain steak and seafood
large portions, low quality

column3: It's a reliably good steakhouse. No real surprises‚Ä¶good or bad.
column4: It's a reliably good steakhouse. No real surprises‚Ä¶good or bad.

column3: I am sure I am overrating this steakhouse, but the Cajun Ribeye might be the closest thing to heaven I have ever...
column4: I am sure I am overrating this steakhouse, but the Cajun Ribeye might be the closest thing to heaven I have ever tasted. I also got engaged here, so I've got that going for me as well.
Get the roast beef hash for lunch - with a sunny-side up egg - it will carry you over to breakfast the following day.

column3: pull up the yacht and bon appetit !
column4: pull up the yacht and bon appetit !

column3: My steak was not as tender as I would have wanted...but sitting by the river with a view of chicago's architectural...
column4: My steak was not as tender as I would have wanted...but sitting by the river with a view of chicago's architectural wonders...can make you forgive the food..

column3: A little pricey but worth it because servings are HUGE. Pea soup is awesome.
column4: A little pricey but worth it because servings are HUGE. Pea soup is awesome.
Way overpriced and touristy
Excellent steaks.
Don't miss the prime rib here.
Big food. Crowded. Great roasted prok.
Great Steaks

column3: Best steak I have ever had! Everything was great and the service was super.
column4: Best steak I have ever had! Everything was great and the service was super.
Really, really good.
Love the creme brulee
Fairly good steak - good view over the Chicago River though

column3: My husband and I save our trips to Smith & Wollensky's for the most special of occasions because there is no...
column4: My husband and I save our trips to Smith & Wollensky's for the most special of occasions because there is no holding back when we are there. We've never made it out of there for less than $150 for the two of us, but it...More
Fairly good steak - good view over the Chicago River though

column3: Go for the atmosphere, but get your steak ANYwhere else!
column4: We chose this restaurant for our anniversary because it was a beautiful evening and we wanted to dine outdoors. S&W is on the Chicago River with a gorgeous view. We were led to a table on the patio as we had requested - so far so good. After greeting us and bringing our cocktails, our waiter, who seemed frustrated with some other tables, made a comment about being "almost done with school and will then come back and burn this place to the ground." We laughed at the joke but were taken aback. We both ordered filets done medium, but mine showed up bleeding and my husband's was well-done. We flagged down the maitre 'd who apologized and had them replaced. He offered complementary dessert and after-dinner drinks for our trouble. My steak came back still quite rare but I wanted to just eat it since we were starving by then. My husband's was OK but mine was so gristley that the manager just looked at my leftovers, apologized again and said it too would be on the house. The worst part was that the steak had no real "meat" flavor. I had read someone else's review that used that statement and had no idea what they could have meant until now! On the positive side, the wine steward recommended a well-priced and absoluely wonderful bottle of red wine (Ottimano Zinfandel) and probably single-handedly saved our evening. We also LOVED the potatoes - buttery and spicy hashed browns. Two out of five stars.

column3: If it wasn't on the river in Chicago...............
column4: THIS STEAK HOUSE WOULDN'T MAKE IT! My Husband and I are native Chicagoans plus we have dined in almost every steak house in Chicago and the U.S., and this has been the worst for service and quality of our steaks, etc...... First, let me say we were treating my Brother for his Birthday and while making the reservation I asked that they bring a small piece of cake with a candle in it to our table, and I also reminded them of this before we were seated, and during our meal, and with all of that they still forgot to bring anything to our table! From the time we were seated I have to say our service was not only slow but unprofessional and just not as polished as it is in most of the steakhouses that I've been to like Gibson's, Ruths Chris, Capital Grill, Flemings, Emeril's or the Rosebud Steakhouse in Chicago which was wonderful! Our steaks which we requested "medium" arrived a good "medium well" dry and not hot the way a steak should arrive at your table. The sides were nothing special. The main dining room is very noisy since it's attached to the bar area which allows smoking and the outside veranda that seems to attract a large after work crowd because of the location on the river. If you're looking for a really good steak in a quiet relaxing atmosphere with good service and no cigar smoke while you're dining -- don't go here!

column3: Fantastic Steak - The best by Far
column4: What an amazing restaurant, the ambience was incredible and its location suburb next to the Chicago River. We found this restaurant quite by chance during a stroll along State Street mid afternoon, the outside patio overlooking the River beckoned us and we stopped for drinks and nibbles. We were so impressed by the level of service that we booked a table for dinner that evening. The New York Strip steak was incredibly tender (all meat is butchered on site) and cooked to perfection. It is slightly more expensive than some other restaurants but I have to say it was the best steak I have ever tasted and defiantly worth every penny!!!

After years of seeing their advertisements in my travel and food magazines, I had a chance to splurge and have lunch at Smith and Wollensky. I was not disappointed.  I was promptly seated on the lovely, flowery outdoor patio and offered a beverage. I chose the house white wine, neither too dry nor too fruity, at $7. A basket of breads was delivered, a mix of sourdough, pretzel bread and a fabulous flat bread with sesame and fennel seeds. With it came a small dish of butter AND a butter-whole grain mustard blend. Delicious! I opted for the shrimp bisque, which was sublime, with just a whisper of red pepper ($9), followed by the lump crab appetizer, served with a delicate ginger-wasabi dipping sauce ( $15, as my entree). Yes, it was expensive for lunch, but everything was so fresh and delicious. They have nice salads, fish, beef and pork selections on the menu, and one "regular" seated near me said they have "the best burger in the city".  The service is what you are paying for here. There is a chap who takes your order, another who delivers it and serves you and yet another who delivers the bill at the end. The only reason I didn't give this place a perfect review is that one of the hosts was a bit snobby to me as I had just come from a long walk around the city and was casually dressed (but not in shorts and white tennies). Everyone else was great and didn't seem to mind that I wasn't in my Sunday best. I'd eat there again in a heartbeat.

Our hotel concierge called for a reservation for us very early on a Saturday evening but when we got to the reatuarant and asked for a window seat in either the upstairs restaurant or the downstairs grill we were told there was nothing available - even though there were only two tables occupied near the windows on each level. We finally chatted with the host enough to get a table with partial water view (one of us could see some water and one looked at a stone wall). Throughout our entire meal no one occupied any of the window tables. The salad was huge and could have been easily shared. It would have been nice if the server had mentioned that. The food was good but very overpriced. The service was okay although somewhat distracted and more so as the restaurant got busier. This is not a restaurant we would return to when we visit Chicago again.
Great Brazilian Steakhouse with bunch of nicely cooked meats. Im giving 4 stars because of the salad bar. The salad bar is okay, but could be much better for the level of this restaurant.
Worth the experience at least once in your life... come hungry as you will enjoy the varied meats, cheeses and other delicacies brought to your table and available buffet-style.
Once again we had an amazing date night. Patrick and Luis and team never disappoint. Thank you for taking such good care of us!
The fried polenta was tasty. The gauchos were overly attentive, almost aggressive. Wasn't the most comfortable experience.
I came here 10 years ago and 4 years ago with good food quality, but now very low food quality and in particular dirty table and glass. No comment the price!

Our server, Estefania, was very attentive to our table and super friendly. The whole system of the restaurant isn't like any I have ever been to. The quality of the meat was superb and the service was more than excellent!
I had a wonderful experience with the staff and I loved the various types of food. The Prime Sirloin was amazing and "Marco" just made our night! It is a must try.

column3: Omar was the best server EVER!
column4: Omar made my anniversary one to remember! He was polite and very attentive to our table. He is awesome! üòÅ
Served like a King, all meat you can eat, do not go to late at evening dough... It's crowded and you get hard to sleep after all excellent food!

Amazing meal in Chicago! As an admin I have arranged many meals at Fogo at different US major cities and have never been disappointed or let down - always superb food and service ‚úÖ Carlo is especially attentive and great at serving
We went to have our first time dinner at fogo it was a very grateful experience Carlos Ramirez was our server he was a excellent server, he was very attentive, the environment and food was great.
We came for a friends birthday. We were serviced by Marco who was a very pleasant waiter. Very nice, and he made sure to take my great pictures of us to capture the moment! Go marco!

Excellent, friendly service. Many of the meats tend to be too salty. Best was the beef rib, tender and flavorful. Others had the Chilean sea bass which was very good. Valet parking available for $6. Parking lot across the street for $11.

column3: Another great meal and dining experience at Fogo de Chao
column4: Once again, had a wonderful experience at Fogo de Chao in River North. Even if you are not a big meat eater, they have an extensive salad bar and delicious sides. Service is excellent and the atmosphere is too.
Great food and service. Our server Carlos Ramirez, was wonderful. Very nice, polite, and attentive. Well recommend!
Amazing food, really good wine for a good price. Our main server Elena was fantastic in attending to our every need. Would definitely go again and reccomend highly.
Excellent place to go eat with the family, service was good so was the salad bar, I highly recommend the filet mignon
Excellent service. The food was amazingly delicious. Thank you Thaty for you great service. Highly recommended to all my friends.

Seriously once again THANK YOU !! we had another great experience we feel very welcome every time, we had another options to go to another restaurants but I personally love Fogo EDGAR YOU ARE THE BEST,,, GRACIAS !!
You better love meat if your coming here. The featured beef and the sirloin and prime rib are great. The lamb is not to my liking and either was the sausage. Nice salad bar if you want to fill up.
Great food experience. Ideal for steak lovers. A little bit more expensive, but you can taste more than twelve different kinds of steak.
Father's day lunch for hubby and I. Staff was wonderful! Food was excellent! Management was so very, very nice. First time visiting this beautiful city of Chicago! Very impressed. We will be back.

column3: Ridiculous waiting time, obviously on purpose as a marketing strategy
column4: Reasonable Food, but a terrible ground operation. The enterprise keeps their guests waiting (in our case more than 90 minutes for almost all parties (some people left)) as a marketing trick, but this should not be rewarded.
We are waiting already 1h for a table for which we‚Äôve made reservation a day before. It‚Äôs very very loud!

column3: As good as the ones in Brazil
column4: I am a regular at Fogo in Brazil, and the one here did not disappoint at all. Renato and Valmor took great care of us, very friendly and prestative guys. Its my favorite Fogo in the U.S.!
Amazing experience. Such warmth makes me feel like I‚Äôm at home!! Manuel M. Was an amazing server!! Please come and see them here in Chicago absolutely worth it all!!
Great time at Fogo de Ch√£o as always We went for my daughter‚Äôs birthday, we had a beautiful time. Paula
Very good experience!! Special to Valmor Walker, that gave us the opportunity to try the special steaks! Really a very good service that differenciate from the others steakhouses! Very good job!!

column3: Always awesome service and incredible food!
column4: Food it's always great but we love the service. Meets are awesome and love the mint jelly. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. Always a great dining experience.
Service is just the best, very attentive and great food. Our server(s) just was out of this world. The food is just to die for! The drinks are great! Happy hour is from 4:30pm-6:30pm Monday-Friday!

Oh my gosh... I'd never been and the system to flag the wait staff when you're ready for more food is to simply flip over your chip and they will be there with more delectable meats prepared to perfection!
Overall great service. Thoroughly enjoyed my time here. Manuel did a great job on making the experience a good one.

column3: Great experience- Valmor was the best and provided us with unparalleled service
column4: We really enjoyed the food, and after quickly learning about our preferences, Valmor brought us our favorite meats until we were ready to stop!!! We greatly appreciated the salad bar as well, with many options besides meat.
My favorite spot in Chicago! Love the rack of lambs! I came for my birthday and the staff kept my favorites coming. Highly recommend.
I went here for my husband birthday, service was impeccable, food was outstanding, best dining Experience
Went there for a group work dinner - it was outstanding! We never even left the table - Green side up all night! Drinks were great, desserts were amazing, but the food....to die for!
Typical Brazilian steakhouse. Service was very good. The meats were delicious. It‚Äôs a bit pricey. Reservations are recommended they get very busy and it can be an issue getting a table.

column3: One of the best Brazilian Steakhouses I have been to
column4: Fogo de Chao Brazilian Steakhouse boasts a massive Salad Bar that gives a good start to your meal. In addition to that, excellent selection of meats are available. Enjoyed my lunch at this restaurant.
This is a premier Brazilian Resturant, Service, food selections and quality is excellent! The quality is top notch and the value for services received is outstanding!
Marco A. was great! We had a fun celebrating our uncle's birthday. The food was fresh and good. The wait time wasn't bad.
Great place. Great food. Amazing waiters. Ask for Marco A. Great guy. Pricing is not to bad as well.

The service was very bad. We couldn‚Äôt have our drinks till the end of the dishes. They served the meat in a hurry. The place was very noisy. It was like a fast food restaurant with unfriendly waiters. Never again.
One of my favorite places for barbecue is Chicago. They have a very large choice of high quality dishes. The restaurant is also very beautiful and clean.
As a typical brazilian, we love meat and Fogo de Ch√£o is our favorite place! Everyone at this place is amazing, including the food ! Valmor is our buddy ! Can't wait for the next time! yummy!
I love it! Awesome food! Went for a birthday celebration. Our waiter Manuel was The best super sweet and very attentive. I can‚Äôt wait to go again!
Big buffer with fresh food and as much meat at your table as you can est. Really nice quality, warm and fresh and very tasty. Atmosphere is not that great, yes its busy, but the service is very good.
If you love meat or if you‚Äôre eating Keto you‚Äôre going to love it! The salad bar is fabulous too. Just pace yourself because the meat is amazing.
the finest of the Brazilian style meat houses. food is simply outstanding and is matched by the service. every time is a winner. great place for a raucous night out.

My husband and I have been here close to a dozen times without fail! The service is always impeccable, and the food is fantastic! Pro Tip: don't fill up on the sides (carbs) even tho they are delicious. Stick with the meat!

column3: Little bit out of city centre
column4: The chain itself is well-known. Food is good and more than plenty. Salad bar is nice also. Mojito's are also recommended.
Superb BBQ food.Top quality.Lot of appetizers,different kind of meet.Graet service.Top desserts. The service and waiters were very pleasant in offering us extra food
One of our favorite places to celebrate or just relax with a great meal. The one Downtown that is, from the service to the food everything was amazing! Looking forward to a return visit.

column3: Pushy service but the food is worth it!
column4: We enjoyed this experience SO much. The meat was delicious..I‚Äôd go back any time. My complaint is that the servers were constantly trying to up sell. We had FOUR servers stop by in a row pushing bottles of wine, not just by the glass. They...More

column3: Little bit out of city centre
column4: The chain itself is well-known. Food is good and more than plenty. Salad bar is nice also. Mojito's are also recommended.
Superb BBQ food.Top quality.Lot of appetizers,different kind of meet.Graet service.Top desserts. The service and waiters were very pleasant in offering us extra food

This was the most famous Brazilian restaurant in Downtown.. What an experience.. The selection of salads, vegies and snacks are at is best.. Minimalist decoration , huge place and excellent service .. Meat service was endless.. We had to keep our request cards on green most of the time.. Especially steak and chicken were delicious.. We did not have any rice , but the fried banana, polenta, and yummy potato puree were very tasty.. We thoroughly enjoyed the meat selection there . Our server Tim was very chatty and attentive. We all enjoyed it and were very full ..

I came to this restaurant for my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday. I was very excited to come here after all the five stars reviews but my experience wasn‚Äôt a five star one. When we were seated two flies came out from the chair and we thought that maybe was a matter of the moment. We had the same two flies on our table the entire time...pretty gross...then I went to the salad bar and saw another small fly around... to add to my bad luck I found an eyelash stuck in my mozzarella piece of cheese. I couldn‚Äôt believe all that was going on, I tried to enjoy the food but trying to keep the flies away from it was extra work I didn‚Äôt need. I mentioned it to the server and he offered to switch us to another table but we didn‚Äôt want to make a big deal after we were almost done eating anyways. The hostess and the server saw the flyers bothering us from the moment we sat down and tried to ignore the situation. My boyfriend was disappointed that we only got the same 3 types of steaks coming over and over and of course chicken and lamb. I don‚Äôt know if this place was having a bad day or what but for how expensive it is they shouldn‚Äôt have flies or an eyelash on their cheese. I‚Äôm still in shock. I came to this place because I had an awesome experience at ZED once and was hoping for the same type of experience. Will not return or recommend.
One of our favorite places to celebrate or just relax with a great meal. The one Downtown that is, from the service to the food everything was amazing! Looking forward to a return visit.

I must say the decorations in the restaurant were cute. The space felt big and wine celler looked cool. Where do I even begin? Our server was ok, I think he was having rough day but another girl, Carol (or Karoll?), made it better. Although our words were limited she understood what I was asking and relayed it to our server and even sometimes got it herself. The black bean stew and rice was a good dish, didn't expect the pork in it but was still yummy. The lentils soup wasn't too bad either but the best parts was the meat cutter. Gacho chefs, if i'm not mistaken, they had 12 cuts and were all delicious. I love the top sirloin cut, that was my favorite. Put some of the chimichurrri on it and AHmazing. Then onto desserts! My favorite was the cream of papaya which Carol (or Karoll) recommended because she like it too. All around we enjoyed ourselves and my guest felt satisfied. Thank you and thank you to Carol (or Karoll).

Everything about this restaurant is perfect; from the general manager, who welcomed us upon our arrival to the restaurant, to the wait staff, especially Vicky and Liz, who kept our plates and glasses full, and of course, to the drinks and food, caipirinhas that taste like Brazil, the large salad bar fit to satisfy carnivores and vegetarians alike, the side dishes that complement the meal, the deliciously cooked meats, the tasty desserst... yummy! Everything about this meal was simply perfect and we look forward to our next meal at FOGO.

Marco D. who happened to be brazilian too, was incredible to us. He truly made this special birthday dinner for my husband and I. He made sure we had everything we wanted. Marco was great at telling us what the various options were without being overly pushy. Bonus points for remembering our names even though we could see he was extremely busy with his other tables. We will definitely try to come more often and not just for special occasions.

Great food at a premium price but way to much time spent on upselling In my opinion way too much pressure on people just wanting dinner who have already had sticker shock arrogance with customers can often create a bigger check but never leads to recurring visits
