column4: Needed a quick lunch in Chicago and Joe's Seafood was the perfect choice. Great seafood salad and very attentive server Sarah. The food is consistent and great.
Excellent apetizers, ecpxcellent meat, excellent sides, excelent dessert and excellent service. Reasonably priced. A must in Chicago.
When ever I go to Chicago, I dine here, the food is superb, the ambiance is great and excellent service, I have been so many times and never been disapointed
Great food and service, pricey but to be expected. Well worth it. I will visit again. Everything about my experience here was great. By far the best food I've ever had in Chicago.

column3: Food was good, not over the top
column4: Service was good, not great. Good atmosphere. The fish that we ordered(Parmesan Halibut) was a bit dry and not flaky like my wife and I thought it would be. Must try the cole slaw.

Dinned there recently w/ a family of 4. We had Alaskan crab, stone crab n dover sole for dinner. Food was very good but not exceptional. However the attentiveness and enthusiasm of Darren made our dining experience a very enjoyable one!

column3: Wonderful Dover sole, key lime pie,
column4: A real treat. Very attentive service. large wine selection, fantastic entrees, salads and sides can be shared, especially the sides. A little crowded, but not bad, could still carry on a normal conversation with friends. We all had fish, which was very well prepared.

Steaks are great, try out the ones that come with the bone. Excellent service, the waiter knew all of the dishes and ingredients top to bottom and gave us some good recommendations. Can't miss the homemade key lemon pie!

Chris and I went to Chcicago to celebrate her birthday, We did not get to eat dinner here but would love to go back and eat. We enjoyed cocktails and appetizers. The Bartender was awesome and the place had a very nice atmosphere.
Excellent meal every time. The parmesan-oregenao crusted flounder is a special treat, and their steaks are all great!

We are steak people, so can't say anything about the seafood. Our steaks were perfecto! Also out of this world baked potato, asparagus, and dessert. Cheerful and helpful wait staff. Yes, it is pricey, but we deserve it every now and then. Do it!

The food was excellent (despite a bit too salty to my taste) and reasonably priced. The stone crabs were really good! Very happy with the service as well and the whole atmosphere made the dining experience quite enjoyable.
The last time I ate at Joe's was years ago. It's nice to see everything tastes as delicious as I remembered. Our waitress, Erin, was helpful and right on with her suggestions.

Fantastic service, fabulous food, priced accordingly. Make ressie well in advance. Close your eyes, glide your finger down the menu and "go with it." No matter what you land upon...it will be delish. Well trained and seasoned wait staff.

Wonderful meal with some out of towners, who agreed the best steak that they have ever eaten, the crab appetizer was superb, the steak just fantastic and the deserts topped off a great meal and experience
Love this place. Expensive but worth it. Great meats and fish, fresh vegetables, great key lime pie, etc.

I enjoyed a wonderful meal last night at Joe's. Their Dover Sole might be the best I have ever had and I order it whenever it's on a menue. The service was outstanding. If I lived in Chicago I would dine here often.

Oh my goodness... Heaven! Everything we ordered was top-shelf - tender, delicious calamari (we think the best we've ever had and we're tried it everywhere); sweet, succulent lobster; and, both tuna and steak like butter. It was a perfect choice for a birthday dinner!
my first time trying stone crab. it was ok. went on a saturday night, so it was very busy. obviously the restaurant is going to be loud. but the service was excellent. the joes scallops were awesome.

You have to make reservations because this restaurant is busy. It is very beautiful inside and all of the staff is dressed elegantly. My waitor was in a blak and white suit. I saw some people dressed more casual but I would not feel comfortable...More

I attended a business dinner in a private room here. We had a fixed menu with pre-selected appetizers. Wow! The platters of crab were absolutely mouthwateringly incredible. And then they brought the second platter of crab! I had the crabcakes as an entree and the house salad. Servings were large, and I was definitely full before the dessert. I will definitely come back to this place to try the steak.

column3: Why is a 6 rating not possible...
column4: Came in on the Saturday to ask for a table, earliest was the Monday at 8.30pm which we took. (Book early!!) When we arrived, we were shown our table and given an extensive wine list and menu. Ordered the 20oz ribeye with bone in, my Mother had the Lobster Tempura, along with baked potato and broccoli. I asked the waiter (Jeff) to select a red wine for myself as I don't really know about wines, the one he selected was excellent and far from the most expensive glass! The steak I had was one of the best i've ever had, the flavour was simply epic! The other thing which really surprised us both was the speed at which our food was prepared. Within 10-15 minutes we had our meals on our table. I was absolutely astounded! They certainly have a lot of staff on the restaurant floor and must have an incredible amount behind the scenes! If you're looking for a special occasion, this is the place! Really, really looking forward to coming back the next time i'm in Chicago, the city should be proud of this restaurant!

Whenever I visit Chicago, I love to eat here. I cannot thing of anything that is not fantastic.  Halibut & Mahi - they prepare this perfectly. The best I have ever tasted. Their seafood blows away any other restaurant I have been to.  Jenny's Mashed Potatoes - delicious with a wonderful topping.  Onion straws - as good as the one's in Cape Cod.  Calamari - very good also.  Bread - they bring out an assortment of about 6 different breads. Very fresh.  Desserts - Peppermint Ice Cream with hot fudge sauce, banana cream pies and key lime pie were fantastic.  Service - excellent.  Keep up the great work.

column3: Great food and service. Make a reservation!
column4: Thankfully I made reservations. We arrived about 30 minutes early thinking we'd get a drink or two at the bar or get seated early - that was not going to happen. After about 10 minutes we finally could get up to the bar! The bartenders were great and shared all of their favorites with us which helpful since so many things sounded tasty. Knowing I wanted to try the blueberry pie (IT WAS AWESOME!), we didn't bother with apps or salad. I had the bone in halibut special, huge portion but wonderful. My husband had the 20oz bone in ribeye, a good steak. We split the garlic spinach and a half order of the corn - get the corn! With the no room we had left, we got half portions of the blueberry and Boston cream pies. We were also given a slice of their key lime pie. The chocolate was a bit too heavy for the Boston cream pie. I'd come back here just for the blueberry pie.

When I said I was there for a consolation lunch, the maitre d' said, You're never alone at Joe's, and Where better to be consoled? And so it was--excellent friendly service, best salmon burger I've ever had (little if any filler, pickled cucumbers and dill sauce to accompany it), choice of side--and I had sweet potato fries, always a favorite. I can't wait to go back and have the chopped seafood salad, another favorite. In fact, I left my credit card behind, requiring a really rapid return!
my first time trying stone crab. it was ok. went on a saturday night, so it was very busy. obviously the restaurant is going to be loud. but the service was excellent. the joes scallops were awesome.

We enjoyed our meal at Joe's as the menu has tons of choices. The calamari was crispy and light. The crab cake was delicious as well. The tuna tartare was tasty but the temperature was not as cold as it should have been. The seafood chopped salad was nice but didn't have as much seafood as I thought it would. The crab bisque is delicious and the crab legs were fabulous. The grilled corn was delicious but the lyonnaise potatoes were just okay. They gave us a piece of key lime pie for absolutely not reason at all (nice surprise) and it was tart and tasty. The Havana pie was to die for. You have to try it. Great meal!

My husband and I had dinner here for our anniversary. We are very picky eaters. He had the Chilean Sea Bass and I had the Alaskan King Crab Legs. First off the food was excellent, the waiter was great and the ambiance was nice too.  The crab legs were fantastic-they crack them for you table side and you can enjoy them with no work and no mess. They were exactly what I had hoped for. Excellent!  We made reservations over a month ahead of time on open table. As for attire, I wore jeans and a nice top. We like places where we are able to get excellent but simple foods and can get away with jeans. I would consider this a very nice dinner (far better than your average-great steak house but not a five star restaurant offering a 7 course tasting menu).

We went for lunch over Memorial Day weekend and had a great time. We arrived fairly early (11:35am) on a Saturday so there was not much of a crowd at that point. I started off with a bloody mary based upon the several drinks that were being mixed at the bar when we walked in. It was excellent and pleasantly spicy (and the blue cheese-stuffed olive was a nice touch). To start, our waiter was outstanding and very helpful. We started with a Caesar salad, crab cakes, and an enormous grilled shrimp from the ‚Äúspecials‚Äù menu (Madagascar Shrimp). The shrimp was remarkably tender and grilled perfectly ‚Äì and, as advertised, huge. The crab cake was not as large as I had hoped for, but there were large whole chunks of very fresh crab and it was very good as well. We had stone crab, copper salmon and halibut for entrees and each was excellent, although stone crab and halibut were probably slightly ahead of the salmon which were very small for the price. Just to be gluttons, we also went with the key lime pie and the strawberry/rhubarb pie: both were excellent. The key lime was perfectly tart (not too sweet at all) and there were large ‚Äúrough-cuts‚Äù from the rhubarb stalk versus the typical fruit puree is found in too many pies.  Overall, while expensive, this was an excellent meal and worthy of all of the accolades found on the other Trip Advisor comments.
The great service is the first thing you notice. Roc was our waiter I always remember the names of the good one's. The food was presented and cooked very well. I will return.

We walked in and we were treated royally. The food was excellent as was the service. What a first class establishment. We ate a late lunch and it wasn't busy. Everything was wonderful, drinks, appetizer, meals, and dessert!

Another family celebration was a wonderful meal at Joe's. Alaskan crab and calamari for appetizers were perfect. Our steaks, sides and desserts perfect. Another wonderful meal at Joe's. it is my boys favorite restaurant !
This place is always bustling. Yet, the service is always great. Big groups get a menu with many choices. Food great, huge portions. Bill is always LESS than expected.

column3: Very good restaurant with great service and atmosphere
column4: Had a very good lunch in this busy and lively restaurant. We did not have a reservation but were fitted in on bar stools by the window. Great service and atmosphere. Enjoyed a long lunch with background jazz music. Recommended
Expensive, but not too bad at lunch. The crab claws are a must. The service was excellent. Good decor and attention to detail.

I went with a very large group. Every ordered something different - fish, poultry, meat choices. Every person raved about their meal. I LOVED the crunchy on the outside, silky on the inside crab cakes. TIP: Dessert servings are super-sized. Plan on sharing.... (or not!)
First night in Chicago, we were recommended to go to joes buzzing place, food good not great for price! However lobster cooked perfectly

column3: Best steak I've ever tasted; went in 2009 and still as good in 2013.
column4: 5 of us went for lunch and all of us highly rated the experience. Excellent quality food, steaks out of this world. Great value for money and worth every penny. Perfect.
We stopped for lunch and had an excellent seafood salad. The service was great, with the diet cokes being refilled before we knew it. A very enjoyable experience.

Fabulous food and evironment. Ordered the crusted halibut and several side dishes for a party of six...everyone thought there dishes were top notch. The environment is great with appropriate noise level and lighting. Would highly recommend.
Joe's is an staple of fine dining in chicago. Menu offers seafood, with fried chicken and steak choices. Food is always at its best. Attentive, professional wait staff, Great vibe.
The crabs here are fantastic. The service is a bit slow but it is a busy venue. The bisque is very tasty.
Joe's never disappoints. The chopped steak, lobster and filets are outstanding. Mark, our server, was great. The pies (any of them) are to-die for.
We had a great meal at this restaurant. The food and service was outstanding. It's a little pricing, but it's a fabulous place for that special evening.
Highly recommend this place. A liitle noisey, but so what.. Crab cakes are super. Waiter very attentive. Easy location to get to.

column3: THE BEST CRAB CLAWS I EVER HAD !!!
column4: If you are a seafood lover and can afford a 200$ dinner for two, you should defiantly put this one on your restaurant bucket list !!! The Crab claws are awesome but you also have to try the Jenny's potatoes on the side !

Went over last weekend. First time in Chicago and Joe's was delicious. Pricey for me but its what I was there to do. Huge crab legs. Excellent service and a free dessert for my anniversary. Top notch.
Excellent service. Food well prepared. Restaurant takes great care in accommodating diners with severe food allergies.

You play, you pay my daddy always said, & Joe's is no exception. At least you get delicious food and top service. Reservations a must, but we like the bar area best. Turns out not affiliated with Miami Joe's, in name & menu only.
Pricey, but won't disappoint. Everything is ala-carte so it's pricy, but the stone crab is to die for. I have not had a bad meal here - average price per person is about $60

The food was delicious. Our waiter, David, was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and the various food flavors, and was a very professional waiter. Tremendously good experience! Would highly recommend it!!
As usual, a great meal at Joes. The stone crab claws were great and our lunch meals were excellent. I would highly recommend joes for lunch or dinner.

This restaurant was great. The wait staff was prompt and attentive. The food was perfect. We were there almost two hours and never felt rushed. Make reservations! We booked about 4-5 days in advance and could not get a seating between 5pm - 10pm.
We dined at the Joe's and were delighted to see friendly and knowledgeable staff. The staek was simply amazing and the coleslaw to-die-for! Probably the best prime steak I have ever had.

I'm sure the dining room is nice, but we've forgone the wait and eaten at the high-top bar tables several times and had fun! The Crab bisque is awesome, the service is good, and all the entrees were excellent.
Joe's does it again. The chopped steak and filets are outstanding. Mac 'n cheese was good as was the baked potato. Mike, our server, was great again. Keep it up.
My colleagues and I loved this restaurant. Don't skip the stone crab appetizer. Best crab I've ever eaten. A little expensive, but so worth it! Wonderful food, wonderful service too.
Great everything, though I haven't tried the crab, the steak makes up for everything. On the expensive side, but great!
Joes was excellent! The seafood was fantastic and everyone enjoyed their dinner. It was very busy, but the server and staff took great care of the group! Amazing dinner!

column3: Very nice place but just average dining experience!
column4: The food was average - stone crab was overrated and I would not order that again considering the cost!. The atmosphere and service was very good!
We celebrated a birthday at Joes in one of their private rooms. The service was excellent and the food delicious.

Had reservations on a Friday night for a family member's birthday. The service and food were wonderful. The stone crabs were fresh and the Dover sole was delicious and simply prepared. Our server was very attentive and provided excellent service to our group of 12.

Food is awesome! Just plain awesome! Wine list is well developed. Service is spectacular and the concierge (Jim) is a great guy and knows how to ensure clients and large parties are taken care of well. You cannot go wrong with this place.
I went for the stone crabs which was awesome, but the calamari appitizer and steak was excellent! Get the mac and cheese!

column3: Like Del Friscos:raucous, with good food
column4: We had a great seafood dinner here, including King crab legs, scallops and Jennie's mashed potatoes, which come with cheese mixed in. This is not the place for a romantic, quiet dinner, but food and service are excellent.
The Stone Crabs are the best. Prime steaks and great sides....the hash browns are cooked to perfection. The atmosphere is pure Chicago....reservations are a must.

It was a Friday, the wait a little longer than our reservation but worth it. The Stone Crabs were just in season and spectacular. The steaks were decent, not the best and by far not the worst. A good restaurant. 4 out of 5 stars.
amazingly good but expensive, worth it but expensive. I had an aged steak and I think it was 75 bucks just for the steak. But, worth it

Even though this is a Miami based family restaurant, it has the Chicago Steak House feel. It's a nice location for couples or they offer several nice meeting rooms for groups. I found the service and food to be excellent.
Great food and service at Joe's. The Stone Crab are excellent and the appetizers were extremely good. When ordering the sides you can probably share one with 2-3 people.
All one can say about Joe's is that it has great food and great service. Prices are high but you know that going in. Best meat in town..
Fantastic place for dining.The food was outstanding and our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.. would highly recommend it!
We have been to many many steakhouses and Joe's consistently serves the best steaks in Chicago. Oh, and the seafood is great too. Service has always been freindly and excellent.
Amazing seafood! Great service by Kieth. This is our new favorite restaurant in downtown Chicago! we cannot wait to go back. A wonderful family owned business.
Just ate there again last evening. The food is superior and they make you feel like you are the only guests in the restaurant. Simply outstanding!
I had steak and also tried the scallops as appetizer.The scallops were amazing to say the least. I love scallops and this are 5 star flavor. Top notch service. Highly recommend!
the place is always abuzz with a full crowd every night! the king crab legs served chilled are a must! also they serve one of the best Dover Sole anywhere!

The best Chicago restaurant - there is so much on the menu which is just utterly delicious you couldn't fail but to have an excellent meal. The staff are delightful. It's a joy to eat here, an absolute joy!
Wonderful service; moved our table when requested. Great waiter (Frank), explained everything. All items were fresh and all points of service were seamless.
We love Joe's! You cannot beat their crab claws. And their seafood specials (John Dory, Turbot) are delicious. It is a fun, festive atmosphere that is good for couples, families or business!
Enjoyed great service from John, he helped us enjoy this special occassion. Scallops melt in your mouth. Everything was perfect. Deep fried lobster and filet were the too good!
The service was as exceptional as the food. I highly recommend this restaurant for a dining experience.
The seafood is fresh and fantastic! The bar area is lively and and appetizers such as the lobster bisque are quite tasty.

Great dinner and seafood was incredible. King Crab is great and they do all the work for you. Lobster tail with my filet was broiled and one of the best I've ever had. Highly recommend, but it's a pricey place for sure.
The place is nice, the service is very good and the manager is very friendly. It worthwile to go because the food is very good and the prices are fair. The wine is more expensive the food.
If you are looking for surf and turf this is the place. Extensive seafood menu (FRESH!) and very good steak and sides. The wine menu is very reasonably priced. If in Chicago, back the truck up!

column3: One of the best restaurants I have eaten at
column4: Absolutely fantastic food and the service was first class. One of the best restaurant experiences I have had in a long time. Highly recommend this place.

column3: Good place and convenient to the hotel
column4: The place is adjacent to the hotel and service is swift. The Caesars salad was great but the steak was a bit disappointing as it was charred and burnt out at the edges. The scallops were of a large portion and tasted good.
Best place to eat in Chicago. 12 oz filet mignon with a baked potato is amazing. Servers are friendly but not too over the top. Food comes out quickly. Very nice
I had the Bone in Ribeye and loved it. Cooked to perfection. My wife had the regular Ribeye and grilled shrimp. Pricey but worth the expense. Upscale environment and great food.

One of my favorite Chicago restaurants. Whether here with a party of two, twenty or a hundred, they have taken care of us with outstanding food and service. I alwyas have one of their awesome martinis and of course have crab!
The most unimaginative meal ever; overcooked white scallops on a white plate, period. Too many wonderful restaurants in Chicago to waste your time here. Service was great.
Extremely good restaurant close to the Conrad. we ate at a table in the bar and the food and service were perfect
Brilliant service great atmosphere and fantastic food, best steak i've ever eaten, wish they had a Joe's in the UK.

column3: The best seafood and fish restaurant in the world!
column4: Everytime we're in Chicago,Joe's is a must visit.Never disapointing,always delivering the great food with professional and friendly service.The filet mignon was incredible.Reservations are a must.

There are a lot of positive reviews here- and they're well deserved. Make a reservation if you can, it's pretty busy. Great atmosphere, service, and food. There's nothing to fear here... I'd certainly recommend it.
Went for a low key work dinner after flying in from Boston. Service was great, atmosphere was alive and food was great.

My wife and I have eaten at the Joe's in Miami. This compares very well. The service was excellent and very friendly. Bone in filet was great choice. The seasonal corn side cannot be missed. Really busy so recommend reservations.

Second time at this restaurant. Food quality is outstanding as is the staff. Prices are what is to be expected for a good Chicago steakhouse. Steak, Fish, and sides have all been top notch. Can be a bit noisey. Reservations are a must.
You gotta have a revs to even get in but once your in, the staff and the food of course is the bomb! Loved loved this place. Will be a staple when I'm in Chicago!

column3: Excellent fish, steak in a fancy restaurant.
column4: We went to this restaurant for dinner, happy with the service, as well the fish special and steak we ordered. Sides are separate charge, but decent sizes. Very relaxing dinner with drinks, desserts.

column3: A Meat and Potato Meal for a King!
column4: If you order the Bone-In Filet and Jenny's Mashed Potatoes, you'll likely have on of the better "meat and potato" meals of your lifetime!
Love this place!! Bisque is the best as are all their appetizers. It is pricey but u pay for the best quality seafood ESP stone crab :)
Great food and service. The crab was very good. The 2d mortgage sampler is a good way to taste a few things. Excellent bisque. Decent drinks, great pie!
Order the crab cake, not surprise, just very typical. Miso sea bass was tasty but over cooked a bit. I would recommend miso sea bass to try.

A well run, and clean place for a spot of lunch. Sat in the bar area and came here due to the good tripadvisor ratings. The menu choice is very good. I would recommend, and certainly return, maybe next time for dinner instead.

column3: Great food - a little pricey, but worth the splurge!
column4: delicious key lime pie and I don't even like keylime pie that much. Bone in filet and crab legs were outstanding
Was in need of a quick bite between conference sessions. It's right across from the Chicago Marriott. Easy to eat at the bar.

column3: Great service, great food and friendly staff!
column4: I enjoy rear steaks and that's exactly what I got. Promt service, knowledgeable and fantastic food. Stone Crabs are the reason we went and they were great too.
King crab legs are stunning (although expensive) and you get lots of them as a main course - go for it!

We had steak, seafood salad, stone crab and a few sides -- corn, creamed spinach. Everything was delicious and our waiter Frank (i think that was his name!) was a wealth of knowledge about the history of the restaurant. The service was excellant!
Was there in 2009 and the food and service were both superb! The salad was perfect and the Salmon was out of this world!!
Great food, as any Joes Crab but very expensive compared to Florida. Still its worth it. Great service, took a while because it was very busy, but great.
First time at Joes...will be back. Stone crabs are great, one gal had a steak, other fish salad, and Dover sole. Everyone was so pleased with the service and the food. Only wished we lived there!!
This is one of my fave seafood restaurants. I love the ambience and the food. Great for date night or to catch up with the girls. U won't be disappointed.
The atmosphere was smart and our waiter was very attentive and experienced. The Pacific stone crabs and pan cooked corn were great, but the rest of the food (BBQ salmon and chicken) was just good.
A little on the expensive side but a very good meal. The side dishes could be shared and were exceptionally good.
Having enjoyed Joe's Miami we were looking forward to dining here.. They did no disapoint. The stone crabs were excellent as was the steak. One of the best lunches ever..
If you've been to the original in Miami Beach (I haven't) don't know how to compare...I could go on and on about the food and service....
We liked everything we ordered! I think Joe's has the best piece of meat in the City(the Bone In Filet).
Excellent service, the food preparation was excellent as was the quality. It comes with a price $200+ for 2 people
Though the meals are pricey they are worth it. The staff is friendly and attentive to all family members. The portions are large so be mindful of sharing.
Our group had the two different types of seafood salads. They were the best. Light and fresh. Highl recommend.
Service was excellent. Had a steak and for one of the top rated steakhouses in Chicago I was disappointed. Was on the dry side. Expected better. Now the Banana Cream Pie was outstanding.
The food was amazing! We shared steak and fisherman's plate, and tried an order of the stone crab. The restaurant is pricy, but well worth it!
Very expensive but was very good. Only thing that bothered me was that things were constantly being taken away from the table whether you were done with it or not.
Food was good especially the scallops. Service was excellent. A little expensive but worth it if you want to treat yourself.
Great atmosphere (a bustling restaurant) - good service and nice steak. Perhaps a little overpriced
food very good, service typical steakhouse but friendly
PLACE: old fashion chicago, a bit overblown FOOD: excellent selection of meat and fish PEOPLE: Tourists and regulars CHERRY ON THE CAKE: Giant Crubs GO THERE FOR: treat yourself like a prince

column3: excellent services nice steak good atmosphere.
column4: Good to eat steak not so excellent about the fish.
This, to me, is the best steak house in town, the fish looked good too, absolute first class service and friendly waiters/waitresses. It does get busy and we had to book, but worth it.

column3: Excellent food, extensive menu but slow service
column4: Great menu selection, excellent food with generous servings but service was rather slow

column3: Great private room for a private dinner
column4: Incredible stone crab and king crab as well as massive shrimp. Delicious steaks, fantastic side dishes. We had a private room for a small business dinner and we just loved it. It deserves it's number one rating.
Expensive but well worth the money. The seafood was the freshest ever. Pretty restaurant and service great.
With all the great restaurants in Chicago, how is this #1? I've been here and the original in Miami. Both are overpriced with snobby staff. The food is good, but not great. No worth the money.
Great Food/wonderful service.A credit card place...very expensive.Everything about it is wonderful and when you leave you'll be glad you went there for a special occasion
been there over 100 times have never had a bad experience.
We always have to go to Joe's when we're in town. The stone crab claws are great and the menu is awesome. Always a few new choices and the service is terrific. Highly recommend.
This place is awesome. We arrived there for our anniversary and they welcomed us with champaign and a warm smile, the food was great. It was the best crab we've had ever.

The food was superb, the dessert was above my expectations, and the service was great as well. Try the peppermint ice cream--they bring you a huge bowl of it with a side of chocolate syrup in its own little pitcher. Delicious!
We tried the stone crabs as well as other seafood dishes and an amazing sea bass fish. All were excellent and the service also superb. Highly recommended
It is pricey but is worth the money! steaks are the best in the city hands down
Good steak, oysters Rockefeller was great. But the restaurant feels like a mosh pit as tables are so crammed it, privacy is not there. Wonderful staff. Boston cream pie was great.
this place has fantastic food, and a good feel for chicago culture. there are things you can order off of the menu, so ask. only reason i minused a star is for price and you need a reservation.
you can order anything off the menu and you will not be disappointed.
Always good seafood and steaks. Little crowded but still worth the wait.
Unbelievable in every way. Best lobster and steak i've ever had. Will be returning soon. Staff was fantastic.
I love this place. Good food, wine, can't go wrong, but bring extra $$$$. It is a treat.
We love stone crab claws so this is the place! Great meal but be aware this restauarnt is always busy. Will definately go back.

We were with a big group and got the private room upstairs, which was very nice. The king crab was the sweetest I have ever had, and everyone at the table enjoyed their meal. The key lime pie is a must have.
Perfect service, perfect setting, perfect dinner. I wish I could eat here every week. The stone crabs were good but, the lobster was even better.

column3: We were in Chicago only 2 days and ate here 2x!
column4: That is how much we enjoyed the food at this place. Great food and very reasonable prices and excellent fast service kept us coming back. If we had been there a 3 rd day we definitely would have been back for more!
Just nothing great here. A slightly overcooked steak, pedestrian appetizers and so-so desert. The service was good, the atmosphere fine but just nothing to get excited about.
I've had stone crab from many places & this place tops it all
Very well organized! We were seated on time and the service matched the awesome menu items. Would recommend the awesome pie as a way to complete a grand dining experience.

column3: Consistent service and amazing stone crabs
column4: Go for lunch to help reduce the cost. Pie desserts can be ordered half if one flavor and have of another flavor.
Do not miss this returaunt it is worth every penny. Splurge on the 2nd mortgage appitizer you wont regret it.

column3: Excellent and expensive, but it's worth the price
column4: Some of the best seafood in Chicago. The steaks are really good as well. I liked eating here, but bring your credit card as it will set you back a few bucks.
The signature bone in filet was a great steak and the seafood I sampled was very good as well. Will be back!
A favorite of mine in Chicago. Always great crab and steaks.
We had another great lunch at Joe's. The stone crab claws were great as usual, but the Crab bisque stole the show. I will definitely order it again.

Seafood Platter is sub par... Creamed spinach is extreme on the garlic. Don't act like your gonna impress someone here... It was my friends birthday, told them when I called, and wasn't even offered dessert on a slow Sunday...?
I had a wonderful dinner here. Ribeye steak cooked perfectly and the crab was wonderful. Service was perfect; was very attentive, however did not "hover."

Went here for dinner late one evening, and was lucky enough that it was Chicago's restaurant week. Best filets we've ever had....cooked perfectly. Also had delicious stone crab bisque. And, the dessert was phenomenal. Could've ate here twice in one week easily.
Great Stone Crab Claws one of the best places to eat in the Chicago area. Worth the wait and price.
We have been here for brunch and dinner. Very tasty both times. Hard to get a reservation!
Magnificent lunch here. Best banana pie ever! The staff was very attentive. Worth it to splurge here.
Incredible service and food as always. Joe's is a family favorite when you want an outstanding dining experience.
Excellent Seafood at a beautiful place! Wonderful service!!
The stone crab totally delivered. Yummy. The wine and cocktails...just ok. Cool vibe and awesome location.
My favorite steak house in Chicago, and there are a lot of good ones. The wine list is impressive, the sommelier is top notch.

column3: Bone around filet mignon & king crab legs were out of this world!
column4: The steak could be cut with a fork and melted In your mouth. King crab legs were sweet & tasty! Definetly give this restaurant a 99%!
Conveniently located across from our hotel. The staff was friendly and jovial, made us feel like old comers. The food was very good even if we mostly ate from the appetizer menu.

This is always one of my favorites stops in Chicago. You definitely want to get a reservation, it's a popular place. Wonderful dining experience from start to finish every time. Have the stone crabs - they are the best!

column3: The best dining experience in Chicago!
column4: This restaurant is unbelievable good!! Sean, our waiter, went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and our trip to Chicago an outstanding experience!
Great Fish and Sandwiches - Good service, nice decor

column3: Joe is the best restaurant in Chicago (My opinion)
column4: I live here in Chicago. I work in Meetings with the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education (ACGME). Whenever there are meetings going on I always stay at the Conrad Chicago. I love the hotel and the restaurant.
I went in the beginning of August 2011. The food was exceptional. It was super busy and crowded but my food was on time. It felt like a party inside but I didn't mind. I would love to revisit.
If you want Joe's, spend the money you'd spend here and fly to Miami and eat at the real Joe's. Probably would be a wash.
Loved the seafood - Extensive wine list!!!! The restaurant felt slightly crowded, but service was still top notch!

We have dined at Joe's on two special occassions, and both times they did not disappoint! This is hands down one of my favorite resturants in the world, food is always awesome and the service is exquisite~
Perfect service, excellent food, nice atmosphere. This place gets it all right.
This is one of the best seafood i ever had just loved it nice atmosphere although there was a child screaming for about 5 minuts..
Am I only person with a burnt steak, soggy vegetables? That would be strange. Decor gets 4.5 stars, service 5 stars, food 2 stars. The bar is nice, if I went back I'd just sit in the bar for dinner.
Amazing steaks and seafood...Try the key lime pie martini! May be the best steakhouse in Chicago...
Crowded of course on a December Thursday, but the full Joe's experience and delightful stone crab claws.

Great seafood. Great steaks. Always crowded...yet always a crowd pleaser. A bit on the pricey side. I think they are related to the Joe's in Miami. Portions are pretty big as well. Bring your appetite.

column3: Nice meal, would have preferred a table
column4: The downside to getting a cheap, last-minute airfare: You can't get a reservation for dinner. We ate in the bar. Food was good, but a table would have made the evening more pleasant.
Great Bone in filet and Seafood appetizer. Service was the reason for the lower mark, took a long time for dinner and felt pushed!
Beautiful experience, amazing crabs and my personal best wine (in the pic, just try!)! Just a little bit expensive, nice place and nice people!
Andy was the quintessential waiter. He assisted us, entertained us, and regaled us. We thoroughly enjoyed this dining experience. All must stop at this destination when visiting Chicago!
Pricey, but good. Service was exceptional and food was excellent. Ambiance was okay. Stone crab was very good, although also pricey.
The only thing that kept me from giving all fives was the slow service. Everything else was awesome. Be prepared to pay for this awesome food but stone crabs were great.
My girlfriend and I each ordered filet mignon, potatoes lyonnaise and asparagus spears with garlic butter. Including a couple of Southern Comfort Manhattans, tax and a 20% tip and the bill was $270.
Went with colleagues. Service was great. Crab claw starter and steak were very good. Nice experience over all.
Everything was great! Party of 4 will cost about $150...
We generally go here for a dry-aged steak that is better than any other steakhouse in Chicago. Never have had to send a steak back and sides are great.
Service was exceptional. Great location! Food was wonderful - would definitely go back.
You won't go wrong. Delicious food and a great wine list. Steaks are amazing as are the crab legs.

column3: Very good, a step away from an excellent experience but I'm not sure whats missing
column4: Our food was really good, the prices seemed reasonable, including the wine list. The whole thing was just as I rated it, very good, not excellent, but I would definitely go back and recommend it.

column3: As good as all the reviews say ...
column4: Great restaurant. Attentive, very professional, well trained, mature service. Simply outstanding steaks, sides and desserts. Expensive, but worth every penny...
There shrimp and there steaks there are awesome they taste so good it's unbelievable!!!!

Joes has fresh king crab in November each year. The sweetness of this beautiful crav doesn't even need butter. We had crab cakes that are always excellent and then more crab. Followed it all with pumpkin chiffon pie. Wow
I guess this place will be the number 1 forever. Everything is gorgeous there: food, service, wine list etcvetc

I have experienced this restaurant for lunch and for dinner. During most "high" seasons in Chicago, especially for more than two dining, you should make reservations. Everything was well prepared and the service is impeccable. My suggestion? The Key Lime Martini!!

Great crab, good steak's and sides, but have you EVER heard of a resturant charging $25 per bottle courage fee because there were six people at your table? I questioned this and was told it was policy.
Very nicely done. Service was impeccable & unobtrusive and food was extraordinary. One of our best meals over four days in Chicago.
The resturant is a little dated in it's decor but the food and service were outstanding. Even though the prices are a little high by most standards it still is an incredible value. Save up and go...
We love everything about Joe's. The buzz, the service and most especially the food!

The food was excellent, especially the rib-eye steak. The service was extremely professional, more than what you'd expect from this restaurant. As for price it was a little bit expensive for what it was.

Went for lunch. My mom and I had the seafood salad. OMG, amazing. Lots of seafood, delish dressing. And the rolls/bread. To die for. The soups were fantastic. The hashbrowns and cole slaw were yummy. Everything was great. Would go again.

If I could take a group of business associates, friends or family to only one restaurant in the Chicago Loop - it would always be Joe's. Best steaks in town, and much much more. Superior customer attention and service.
Across from our hotel, wanted to eat at one in Miami but in the summer it was very hard to get into. This one had easy access to lunch. Great food, service Was awesome. Would recommend!!

column3: Excellent food, great atmosphere and service
column4: Make sure to book as we did but we still had a lengthy wait

column3: THE best service I have has in the USA
column4: bit over priced, but food is good and service is remarkable.
If you like a good steak, this is the place to be.
Delicious. Stylish. Friendly. Busy. Very very recommendable
Has to be one of the finest places I have eaten in this country. I liked it so much that I went 2 of the 3 nights I was in Chicago. A true dining experience.
There's not one thing bad I can say about this restaurant. Service, food, desserts.over all just a fine experience.

I recently dined at Joe's with colleagues while on a business trip. The food is delicious and what's even better is the service. The servers are very extremely attentive, friendly and knowledgable. I will definitely visit Joe's again when I return to Chicago!
I went with my Family and it was a great experience, The Best stone crabs , and an excelent wine list, i Will come again!!

column3: Stone Crabs just like their South Beach Location....
column4: if you have not tried Stone Crabs it's a bucket list item for sure. Joe's does Stone Crabs better than anyone, anywhere. It doesn't get any better. You can get everthing else they serve anyplace. go for the Jumbo Crab claws. They are not chep.

Just as good as the Miami original. Cole slaw is exactly the same, the stone crabs are just as good. The sea bass in miso was a hit, as was the key lime pie for dessert. Steve was an excellent waiter.

column3: Nice restaurant, very friendly staff, fresh seafood. Crab bisque needs MORE crab!
column4: My VERY FIRST meal ever in Chicago! First time visit! Nice restaurant Very friendly staff Fresh seafood Crab bisque needs MORE crab! Shrimp scampi was fresh and nice!

My husband and I ate at Joe's while spending a weekend in Chicago. The restaurant definitely lived up to expectations and the steak (we both had bone-in filets) was phenomenal. Definitely on par with the best steakhouses in Chicago.

column3: Wonderful experience. The lobster salad was stupendous.
column4: I will definitely go back soon. Excellent food and service. The lobster salad was superb. The children loved their fried chicken.
The lobster salad was stupendous. Everything was excellent.
Steak and eggs had worst steak ever. Inedible. To their credit they took it away and took it off the bill. Confusing situation with waitress but we won't be back so it doesn't matter.

column3: 3 days in Chicago, 2 dinners in Joe's! Not enough! Never enough!
column4: Love the Alaskan King Crab Leg! I'll save all the money on other crabs coz I just don't have any interest in the crabs elsewhere anymore after having Joe's chilled King Crab Leg! The scallop is incredible, too!
Super service, wine list, stone crab and steak - fillet on the bone - it's really hard to fault this place at all. Eat here......oh and book or be disappointed.
Doesnt compare to the Miami establishment under the same name but different ownership. Wait staff was poor. Steak was a bit over-done.
Try this place! The crabs are wonderful and the same for all the seafood proposed. It is expansive but they are money well spent. Excellent wine List.
Get the Madagascar shrimp and try the stone crab! I had a bone in ribeye med rare. It was defintaley rare but still good.
The service was good. The stone crabs were terrible, a total waste of money. The rest of the meal was good. A little expensive for what you got. I do not think I would return.

column3: The food was amazing. The steak and the...
column4: The food was amazing. The steak and the seafood were some of the beat I've ever had. The service was also top notch.

We have eaten here several times. Steaks are always delicious and cooked to order. Sides tasty. Service is first class. Even with a reservation there is generally a wait, but it is worth it. Good value, excellent food.
We've been here twice. Hard to get reservation. We've just ate in bar area. First come first served. Get to see everyone come in. Drinks good, Food good. Help very nice.
Amazing food, service, location, ambient. 2 thumbs up for Joe's!

column3: Great food but extremely busy busy busy
column4: The food was fantastic ... and there was plenty of it ... but this is not the place for a romantic dinner. Make sure you make a reservation.

On entering, I thought it was loud and noisy, but once seated, that changed. The food was great and the service wonderful. With a large group, we didn't expect too much, but we certainly received everything we could want.
Great dinning experience, their steaks was great. If in the windy city you must check this place out.

column3: Excellent restaurant for that special occasion!
column4: Expensive, but completely worth it. Amazing seafood, service and wine list. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!!! You have to try the Stone Crab !
You do not have enough space at the bar to eat your King Crab legs, which are delicious.

column3: Very good but busy and loud
column4: Top quality seafood, very good service. High prices and noise level. It's very good but not the best in Chicago.
One of our favorite dining spots. We love the stone crab in fact all of the seafood is very good. Don't mind paying for good food and service, we just love dining here.

Had lunch in the bar area, we prefer the more relaxed atmosphere. The bloody mary can be a meal in itself. Love their salads, husband always has to have the stone crab, be prepared for a pricey lunch, but splurge if you can.
Excellent food and very attentive service. The prices are on the higher side, but that's true of many places in the area, It wasn't that hard to sign the check; it was very nice evening.

column3: Great salmon but the vegetables covered in cheese
column4: Great meal. OK service. Salmon excellent. The tomato dish covered with cheese and a slice of cheese. Not very healthy.

column3: Seafood is always fresh, the service is fabulous and the martinis are excellent!
column4: Seafood is always fresh, the service is fabulous and the martinis are excellent!

column3: Great food, great service, a must restaurant!
column4: A highllight of our trip. The stone crabs were amazing and so was their fresh Alaskan King crab legs. The staff was A plus. The only thing better was USC victory over Nortre Dame. We will be back in two years!

column3: The most amazing stone crab I've EVER had in my LIFE!! Flown in fresh, just like they came out of the Deadliest Catch...
column4: The most amazing stone crab I've EVER had in my LIFE!! Flown in fresh, just like they came out of the Deadliest Catch right on to your plate. Very expensive, but worth EVERY dime!!!! Get reservations because it is very hard to get in!

column3: Great Service, great food, not stuffy
column4: We had a table of 5..Stone crab claws, bone-in-filet, liver and onions. All were just great. Highly recommend the HAVANA DREAM PIE for dessert. Fortunately we had dinner early because it took several hours to come down from the high.
Had an excellent dinner.
This is a great steak place in Chicago. Very hard to get into so make reservations at least a month in advance. The service is great and the food is good as well. Wonderful crab legs here!

Wow - great traditional steak house. Fillet was great. Stone crab claws great. Scallops were fabulous. The best was the chopped salad with the house dressing. Amazing flavor and taste. You will not be dissappointed.

column3: Fantastic!!! Expensive, but totally worth it!
column4: A little bit of Heaven on Earth. The Stone Crabs, the Scallops and the Rib in Filet. Oh my! Do what you have to do to treat yourself to those items. You will thank me!
Overall a nice experience. It was a little pricey but the food was very good. Unless you are hungry, I would get your side orders with 1/2 order. They are large. The service was very good.

column3: Good food, fresh and tasty, but lil expensive
column4: Good food, fresh and tasty, but lil expensive

column3: always good, like any Joe's Seafood
column4: always good, like any Joe's Seafood
Excellent seafood
eww...
wonderful steak and seafood
i heart steak and shrimp

column3: Eh, it's not as fresh as...
column4: Eh, it's not as fresh as Florida.
Steaks are great, so are the crab legs!

column3: The best steak and coconut cream pie I ever tasted in the US!
column4: The best steak and coconut cream pie I ever tasted in the US!
love the bone in filet

column3: pricey, but well worth it. fantastic steaks and stone crabs
column4: pricey, but well worth it. fantastic steaks and stone crabs

column3: OMG...from drinks to crab bisque to daily specials you can't go wrong....if you can get into this restaurant.
column4: OMG...from drinks to crab bisque to daily specials you can't go wrong....if you can get into this restaurant.
Good food, but nothing spectacular.
A true favorite!
Good food, probably not worth the price though

column3: Great food, great service, great meeting space.
column4: Great food, great service, great meeting space.
Some of the best seafood I've had in Chicago and the service is impeccable.
Best seafood I have had in Chicago. Professional & knowledgable servers. One of my favorites in the Windy City.
Mediocre food. Not worth the price.
Awesome place!
Some of the BEST seafood you'll have in Chicago. Hands down. Their stone crabs are pricey, but a definite must order. They are super fresh and sweet. Definitely a wonderful meal.

column3: Everything is always great at Joe's - the service, food, and wine!! This is my favorite place for surf'n turf in...
column4: Everything is always great at Joe's - the service, food, and wine!! This is my favorite place for surf'n turf in Chicago!!
Best seafood in teh city
I have never had better service at any other restaurant. Food was awesome as well...
I've never had anything bad from here...
Very good. I never order any Maryland crab from there since the market price is ridiculous and I'm from Maryland. But everything else is great!

column3: Solid. Not Miami by a long shot though.
column4: Solid. Not Miami by a long shot though.
Expensive but so good!
Consistent (never had a bad meal) food and top notch service. The king crab legs prepared table side are the best. Surprisingly, the best steaks in Chicago.
Great seafood, but just a little stuffy and pretentious.
Loved the Stone Crab!
This is my happy place!!!
Not very impressive.
Love to have lunch there on Thursdays at the Bar. The bartender is from New Orleans and is a complete blast. No I am not drinking at lunch.

column3: Known for their stone crabs, which are heavenly, Joe's bone-in filet may convert even the most diehard vegetarians.
column4: Known for their stone crabs, which are heavenly, Joe's bone-in filet may convert even the most diehard vegetarians.
Stick with the original in SoBe

column3: the most delicious sea food, crab specially in Chitown, expensive but worth every penny
column4: the most delicious sea food, crab specially in Chitown, expensive but worth every penny
um...delicious!

column3: Just like the one in Miami--the stone crabs are just amazing.
column4: Just like the one in Miami--the stone crabs are just amazing.
Mmmm...Stonecrab and lobster bisque
Nothing better then some stone crabs claws and some key lime pie!
love the crabcakes

column3: the Second Mortgage is quite impressive. delicious stone crab.
column4: the Second Mortgage is quite impressive. delicious stone crab.

column3: If you want good stone crabs and seafood, go there! I have to edit my previous review... the stone crab was not good at...
column4: If you want good stone crabs and seafood, go there!
Good but waay pricey!
Fabulous food. Expensive.
In my top three downtown for a "nice night out". Excellent service, very good seafood, steaks, & desserts (go hungry!)
They have the best apple pie ever!
Mostaccioli with meatballs very bad
really like this place

column3: Even though this is known as one of the best "Stone Crab" restaurants in town, their bone in filet is one of...
column4: Even though this is known as one of the best "Stone Crab" restaurants in town, their bone in filet is one of the best!

column3: Too crowded but worth the wait!
column4: Too crowded but worth the wait!

column3: I get to go here every May for a sales dinner...awesome food!
column4: I get to go here every May for a sales dinner...awesome food!

column3: Stone crab is always a treat, and not one easily found in Chicago.
column4: Stone crab is always a treat, and not one easily found in Chicago.
Took clients here, had an excellent time. The best steaks, fantastic stone crab, good wine list and great waiter. Few places in Chicago rival this one. Worth the money.
Packed bar/wait area but honored our reservation on time. Had to try the" famous" Stone crab claws as an appetizer but just ok and overrated. Very good steaks and service. Wine list ok

Make reservations! Our dining experience here was very enjoyable. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. I had the crab (excellent), and my husband raved about his steak. The wine list is fabulous. I would definitely go back again.
Packed bar/wait area but honored our reservation on time. Had to try the" famous" Stone crab claws as an appetizer but just ok and overrated. Very good steaks and service. Wine list ok

Make reservations! Our dining experience here was very enjoyable. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. I had the crab (excellent), and my husband raved about his steak. The wine list is fabulous. I would definitely go back again.

column3: our best dining experience in Chicago
column4: My husband and I went to an early dinner here. We noticed that it was the #1 restaurant listed on opentable.com. We were really impressed. Our waiter was fantastic and the food even better. Perhaps after our night at Signature Room at the 95th (John Hancock center)the night before shaped our opinion a little. We were really bummed out by that experience....crappy service and food and a lot pricier. Any time we come back we are sure to revisit Joe's Seafood. It is a gem!

column3: Best seafood and steak I've found in Chicago
column4: This has become my favorite Chicago restaurant. It's the only place I know of that has both top notch seafood and steaks at reasonable prices. As with any establishment managed by Lettuce Entertain You, the service is excellent. The servers are extremely well versed in all aspects of the menu and wine list. I've noticed that several steak places in this area of the City (River North) serve "choice" steaks.. as indicated by the name not here.. don't make the mistake of overlooking the prime steaks on Joe's menu particularly the bone in selections ( the bone in filet is unbelievable). A stone crab and king crab appetizer goes extremely well with their steaks. The side dishes are large enough to split up to 4 ways. Don't miss this restaurant. You won't be disappointed

As a stone crab fan caught in NY, I had been eagerly awaiting a visit to Joe's while on a recent trip to Chicago and I was not disappointed. Our group of four were all enthusiastically in approval of both the food and the service at this restaurant.  Between us we enjoyed the stone crab, lobster tail, shrimp, and king crab legs, all of which were excellent (the steaks also have a great reputation but we were all about the seafood). The key lime pie is divine and better than anything of the many I tried while actually in Keys.  Our waitperson, Amy, was most attentive and extremely accomodating, making great recommendations & going off the printed menu to put together some combo entree plates for those of us who were incapable of deciding between all the heavenly offerings.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a great meal out while in Chicago but be sure to make reservations! They fill up fast!
Packed bar/wait area but honored our reservation on time. Had to try the" famous" Stone crab claws as an appetizer but just ok and overrated. Very good steaks and service. Wine list ok

Make reservations! Our dining experience here was very enjoyable. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. I had the crab (excellent), and my husband raved about his steak. The wine list is fabulous. I would definitely go back again.

I went to the Joe's in Miami a few years ago and loved it. Since I was going to Chicago for a weekend, I thought it would be fun to try the Joe's there. The restaurant in Chicago pretends to be a high-class steak and seafood house, but there are some problems. First, although I had a reservation (which they confirmed by phone TWICE), we still had to wait 30 minutes to be seated. I find that inexcusable, and by the time we were seated we were already in a bad mood: What's the point of making and confirming a reservation if it wont be honored? Second, the food was really average: my colleague's fish was plain grilled, my crab claws did NOT taste fresh, the salad was plain old lettuce in a bowl, the wine pours were short, about 4oz, and they hold the food to see if you'll order another glass. The only good part of the meal was the key lime pie (great crust). Our service was fine, but nothing special. For a $175.00 meal for 2, I was not impressed and would not go again.

Visited Joes last weekend while in Chicago. 2 of us split a bone-in-filet, jennys potatos, a salad, and 6 stone crab legs. No drinks, and the bill was $110 before tip. More than one pays for a high-end meal in St. Louis, but the food was so good. Especially the crab legs. The filet was great, but I've had better for less money. Jenny's potatos were awesome. I would definitly come back here again for a nice yet pricey meal.
