Make reservations! Our dining experience here was very enjoyable. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. I had the crab (excellent), and my husband raved about his steak. The wine list is fabulous. I would definitely go back again.

I went to the Joe's in Miami a few years ago and loved it. Since I was going to Chicago for a weekend, I thought it would be fun to try the Joe's there. The restaurant in Chicago pretends to be a high-class steak and...More

Visited Joes last weekend while in Chicago. 2 of us split a bone-in-filet, jennys potatos, a salad, and 6 stone crab legs. No drinks, and the bill was $110 before tip. More than one pays for a high-end meal in St. Louis, but the food was so good. Especially the crab legs. The filet was great, but I've had better for less money. Jenny's potatos were awesome. I would definitly come back here again for a nice yet pricey meal.

column3: A Word From A Devoted Alumni
column4: Just a word to all of you who love Joe's Chicago as much as I do. If you're ever in South Beach, don't miss the original. It was the first restaurant on Miami Beach, and it's a true classic. My first trip to Joe's came when my parents took me in 1955, and no matter how many times I've returned, it remains the same five-star establishment. It's only open seasonally - when the stone crabs are availiable, so be sure to check before you go. Don't miss the wonderful bread (the only thing missing from the Chicago location), the browned potatoes - and the key lime pie is extrodinary. All of these I've sampled in the Chicago location and except for the bread, live up to the original.

Visited Joe's with seven business colleagues. We were all bowled over.  Extremely friendly service (led by Hank, the head waiter) and a great atmosphere. The crabs and fish are good, but take it from me that the New York strip steak is great.  Pretty good wine list, too.  I can't recommend Joe's highly enough. You can book here with total safety and will have a fabulous evening out.

column3: our best dining experience in Chicago
column4: My husband and I went to an early dinner here. We noticed that it was the #1 restaurant listed on opentable.com. We were really impressed. Our waiter was fantastic and the food even better. We both had steaks and found them to be perfect. I ordered the apple pie for dessert....the best I have had in years. The atmosphere....and music was lovely. I can't recommend it highly enough. Perhaps after our night at Signature Room at the 95th (John Hancock center)the night before shaped our opinion a little. We were really bummed out by that experience....crappy service and food and a lot pricier. Any time we come back we are sure to revisit Joe's Seafood. It is a gem!

I was in the restaurant the 29th of november ( evening)with group of french radiologist (7 or 8) ; I went for RSNA(groupe Mme Parisot/Altana)  good atmosphere and I was alone to choose a fishmeal  at the finish the servant gave me"special potatoes" only for me he said  after few hours in the nigth in my hotel I was terribly ill with vomiting and diarrh√©a during few hours; a friend gastroenterologue specialist said that it is toxic alimentation so I am very angry about your cooking (I have been there few years before without problem!)  for informatio,

column3: Best seafood and steak I've found in Chicago
column4: This has become my favorite Chicago restaurant. It's the only place I know of that has both top notch seafood and steaks at reasonable prices. As with any establishment managed by Lettuce Entertain You, the service is excellent. The servers are extremely well versed in all aspects of the menu and wine list. I've noticed that several steak places in this area of the City (River North) serve "choice" steaks.. as indicated by the name not here.. don't make the mistake of overlooking the prime steaks on Joe's menu particularly the bone in selections ( the bone in filet is unbelievable). A stone crab and king crab appetizer goes extremely well with their steaks. The side dishes are large enough to split up to 4 ways. Don't miss this restaurant. You won't be disappointed

As a stone crab fan caught in NY, I had been eagerly awaiting a visit to Joe's while on a recent trip to Chicago and I was not disappointed. Our group of four were all enthusiastically in approval of both the food and the service at this restaurant.  Between us we enjoyed the stone crab, lobster tail, shrimp, and king crab legs, all of which were excellent (the steaks also have a great reputation but we were all about the seafood). The key lime pie is divine and better than anything of the many I tried while actually in Keys.  Our waitperson, Amy, was most attentive and extremely accomodating, making great recommendations & going off the printed menu to put together some combo entree plates for those of us who were incapable of deciding between all the heavenly offerings.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a great meal out while in Chicago but be sure to make reservations! They fill up fast!
The steak was one of the best I‚Äôve eaten in the U.S. Atmosphere is conducive to conversation and service is good.
Dry aged steaks are one of the best in the city. Service, ambience, good selection of wines balance out the experience.
We sat downstairs in the parlor. The ambiance, food, and service were all excellent. Just be prepared to spend a decent amount of money especially if you plan to drink.

column3: So good I'd fly in JUST for this
column4: Ya ever encounter food on your trips that you miss when you're back home? This is definitely one of those!... cant wait to be in Chicago again
Fantastic atmosphere! Lovely and very helpful staff. Food is prepared to perfection. Definitely coming back one day!
It is classy and hip. They serve the best and most tasty lamb chops. Excellent wine selection. Friendly staff from the greeting by the hostess to the serving staff. Highly recommend.
My son treated me to a wonderful dining experience at this amazing establishment for a father/son night out. The staff, atmosphere, food, and libations were beyond amazing! Highly recommend!
I was invited here for a date. Loved the atmosphere, the ambiance is romantic with the dimly lit bar. Will be back without the date :)
Have visited many steak and seafood restaurants in our frequent travels to Chicago. This is the best!!!!

column3: Great meal - cheeseburger and bone marrow
column4: Bavetta‚Äôs is a steakhouse however I had a cheeseburger at the bar. It was a tasty, juicy burger. One of the best I had in a long time. I also had the bone marrow as an appetizer. Delish! Definitely worth a visit.

As I‚Äôve gotten older, atmosphere has become as important as the food. Well, this restaurant has both! We loved the ambiance. The dry aged ribeye was very good. Steak tartare was excellent. Highly recommended.
Best filet mignon i have every eaten. Best Old Fashion (Tokyo) I have ever had. Service is aweomse. Ambiance is great. Amazing experience.
We have been here twice, once with couples and once with family. Both times we were impressed with the quality of the food. No one was disappointed!

column3: Amazing food, service and overall experience!
column4: My sister, niece, daughter and I enjoyed a fabulous dinner before seeing Hamilton. Food was top notch. Go for the steak!
Yes it is classy and hip, but I would go to a hole in the wall with no charm at all to get the lamb chops they serve. Everything we had was great, but the lamb chops were just outstanding.

What a wonderful restaurant. Our waiter Joel was very friendly and helpful. The drinks were delicious as was our meal. We chose steaks and the brussel sprouts as a side. They were the best we ever had! We would definitely love to dine here again.
Great restaurant with speakeasy setting. Dark and romantic and the food was top notch. Also there is a bar downstairs that had great cocktails.
Your toes will curl with all the flavors. I don't think I'll ever bite into another steak so amazing.

column3: Loved the vibe and the steak!
column4: Pre-theater dinner with clients. This cake highly recommended. The atmosphere was different and the steaks were delicious. Would definitely return for a date night!

Highly recommend. My wife and I enjoyed a relaxing, delicious meal - crab legs, Filet Mignon (you could cut with a fork), and the best chocolate pie that we have ever eaten. Eat there when you get a chance!

Steaks were grilled flawlessly. Both the normal and dry aged cuts were impressive and come in generous portions. The sides were also great, especially the corn and truffle mac and cheese. Decent wine list.
Not only its a beautiful place with an awesome vibe.. food out of this world and service beyond fabulous.. one of my top 10 all in all places in USA

My daughter made this reservation for us ~ 2+ months ago. My wife and I were visiting from Texas. I have eaten many steaks in my time and I must admit this was one of the very best. Good service, good sides, good experience.

column3: Always happy and satisfied at Bavette.
column4: Great steak. Great service. Lovely and professional hostesses. People have a good sense of humor. I tend to take out of country guests there, or just go with family. Mehran (of Chicago)

Had dinner for five here on a Tuesday night. It‚Äôs tough to get a reservation but worth the effort. Seafood tower was great. Steaks were fantastic. We loved the decor and feel of the joint. Don‚Äôt settle for the chain next time in Chicago!

column3: A love child of a steakhouse and a speakeasy
column4: Great meat experience in an atmosphere if a trendy bar. Good selection of cocktails. Love the bone marrow with steaks.
Best steak in the city!! Bar area is second to none. Very dim speakeasy feel. Drinks were made with precision and Flair!
We came for dinner after reading others reviews. Dark rooms,beautiful chandeliers,lovely bar and fantastic service

We dined there about 1.5 years ago and we were completely satisfied with everything. Really liked their corkage fee for BYOB: Share a glass with a neighboring table! Now that's first class! Highly recommend this restaurant.
This restaurant is really hard to ge into but worth it by far. The atmosphere is sumptuous. The dinners are excellent. The deserts are great. The service is exceptional. Best in Chicago.

Went here for a family dinner while I was in town visiting. Incredible steak, strong cocktails and outstanding service. I loved the vibe of Bavette's, too. I'd recommend this spot to anyone looking for a great steakhouse in Chicago.
Surprising venue, excellent food, very good service. Still, compared to European standards prices are over the top. Glad I was here on invitation. 150$ a person is what you will spend on average.
I had a reservation for two at 7pm. The man at the entrance did not find it. Instead to apologize, he was very unfriendly. We had to wait more than 1h and had got a terrible table.
Definitely make a reservation. We got extremely lucky and found a couch down in the basement to sit at. Service was terrific, food was even better. We would absolutely go back.

column3: A visit to a highly recommended place
column4: This is a great restaurant. Not cheap but adequate. The environment was great and even better was service. Service was harmonious, non-intrusive, pleasant. Menu and wine list are excellent. Emphasis is on meat dishes but there are alternatives, appetizers were fantastic.

We had a fantastic evening, with excellent food and wine. The interior is a must see and added to the ambiance created. The service was very good. We will definitely return again. Any of the steaks on the menu would be a great choice.

column3: Unique Ambiance with Excellent Food & Service
column4: I‚Äôve dined at Bavette‚Äôs many times. I enjoy the grotto-feel of the downstairs bar and dining area. It‚Äôs dark down their with romantic lighting and circular booths where couples can sit side-by-side to smooch a bit between courses. Everything on the menu is excellent. This...More

column3: High end steakhouse, delicious food, excellent service, a bit overpriced.
column4: I have been to amazing steakhouses all over the US, and many abroad. Every once in awhile, one will ‚Äúwow‚Äù me. This one came close, but a $550 tab for four should nail it, every time. The dutchess cut filet is already served with bernaise, so ordering it ‚ÄúOscar style‚Äù, gets you a few pieces of crab, no asparagus, for an additional $24. I don‚Äôt mind paying high prices in restaurants, but I do mind leaving with the feeling I‚Äôve been ‚Äúhad‚Äù just a bit.

Great food unbelievably bad attitude..  We were seated 30 minutes after our confirmed reservation.  We were seated at a corner booth and we're shortly told repeatedly thereafter "told we needed to immediately relocated because they had a much larger party that needed to sit in our booth"  Moved to a lesser table and watched a party a group of 4 replace our party of 3 at our original table.  Won't be going back there anytime soon  Positives-  Excellent food quality  Great service  Innovative and unique wine corkage program. No corkage fee as long as you share a glass with another table!  The conked out side dishes  Negatives  Condescending and very arrogant attitude  30 minute delay to get seated, past confirmed reservation time  There are many equal or better restaurants in close private proximity

column3: A visit to a highly recommended place
column4: This is a great restaurant. Not cheap but adequate. The environment was great and even better was service. Service was harmonious, non-intrusive, pleasant. Menu and wine list are excellent. Emphasis is on meat dishes but there are alternatives, appetizers were fantastic.

column3: Great start to our Chicago trip ..
column4: Recommended Bavettes by friends here .. It‚Äôs a huge cavern of a place .. but every table was taken . It‚Äôs quite dark inside but plays nice jazz which sets the mood .. we covered most of the menu .. highlights being the crab cakes ( amazing ) bacon and cheese salad and short rib pasta .. superb. Steak frites also gets a mention .. comes with the biggest pile of fries .. awesome. So make sure your hungry going to Bavettes .. it‚Äôs where quality and quantity rules.Comes highly recommended.. Enjoy !

We were recommended this restaurant by our front desk agent at the Raddison Blu hotel. She called the restaurant for us and we were lucky enough to get a reservation since it was already past dinner time. Great ambiance, delicious steaks and top notch service. I'm glad we got to try this restaurant on our visit to Chicago.

Where do I start - make a reservation to avoid waiting because you will wait - we had a reservation which we made a month in advance - I call it out because the people that sat next to us had to wait two hours - so worth every penny - This meal was by far the BEST I‚Äôve had in Chicago! The service was awesome - Thank you Meredith!! The Steak was incredible but most of all the mashed potatoes were mouth watering & to finish.....Carrot Cake was WOW!! So yummy & I will be back - do yourself a favor & try this place, you will NOT be disappointed.

We had a fantastic evening, with excellent food and wine. The interior is a must see and added to the ambiance created. The service was very good. We will definitely return again. Any of the steaks on the menu would be a great choice.

column3: Some of the Best Food in the City
column4: I've dined here twice. Both times it was amazing. The first time we came as walk-ins and ate at the bar. There was no shortage of great service at the bar. The Bar tender was great with suggesting food and drinks. The second visit was with a reservation after a Comedy show. Once again the food was delicious, the service excellent and the atmosphere very laid back. Definitely one of my favorite places to go in the city.

Most reviews have pegged Bavette‚Äôs as the best steakhouse in the Windy City, and in two words, I agree. It‚Äôs not easy being the best in the cow capital of the United States, but they have succeeded. I had been to their Vegas restaurant, but could only snag a last minute 5:30 spot for a quickly planned Chicago trip. I would have gone for breakfast. The ambiance, the filet, the truffle mac and cheese....you get the picture. Our waiter Joel was beyond compare...he made us feel like our last name was Daley. I usually take a pass when only 5 PM and 9:30 PM is available. Not here.

Excellent experience - a trendy/lively vibe and the food was top notch (best steaks on our trip). Our server and Matt the manager provided five star service. In a city full of steakhouses (we visited several others), this one is not to be missed.

column3: Best steak I have ever eaten
column4: The steak was amazing. People are horrified that I eat my steak well done, but here is still melted in your mouth.
Great ambiance, service and food! A Betty good overall experience. The bone-in fillet was perfectly done and flavorful. Great drink options.

What can I say... it's one of the best in Chicago. Everything on the menu is awesome especially the seafood and steaks and sides and friend chicken and drinks... you get the point. Make a reservation they're usually booked up for weeks
This has to be the best steak I've had. I had the bone in strip. I swear, the meat was so tender, you can cut it with a dull spoon. Service great, sides good. But I was there for the steak.
I lived in Chicago for 8 years and best steak I have ever had! Highly recommend. Service was excellent. BYOB made it a great deal
Lion's Tail cocktail was the best I've ever had. Ambiance and music was amazing. Delicious food all around. $50 cork fee waived if you share a glass of your bottle with another table.

This place is one of the best steakhouses in Chicago. Delicious tender prime ribeye. The frites and aioli are scrumptious also. The place has charming decor, romantic but is super dark inside. I think they should light it a little more.
The best all around restaurant in Chicago. Ambiance, food, service, all amazing. Eat here and you will not be disappointed.
The food was amazing! The Shortrib Stroganoff is a must! As well as the Classic Ribeye-Chicago Cut! It is pricey, but worth it! It also has a great atmosphere! I would denfinitely go back!!

The steak was out of this world...juicy tender delicious,and .cooked to perfection. I don‚Äôt eat beef that much anymore but when I do....I want it to be great and it was Excellent and pleasantly efficient service Will do it again
Beautiful place with great ambience and menu. The food was delicious. I had the petite filet mignon which was perfectly cooked. Nice music and friendly service. I had an awesome evening.
Quick bite to eat tonight, arrived about 6:30. No problem getting 2 seats at the bar. Dinner was delicious and service was fantastic. Shiz took care of us and we enjoyed the night!
Bavette's is a Chicago staple. Each time a friend comes to visit, I will take them to Bavette's - it is undoubtedly a favorite.
I feel transported to a secret 1920‚Äôs restaurant when I walk in. Amazing food, drinks and people! Definitely my favorite in Chicago. Ps. Save some room for desert!

Great food the hostess was very upity and acted very affected. She was to young to greet patrons with a snippy attitude. Not a great impression but the rest of the evening was delightful and the food was really good !!!
Great beautiful experience. Will do it again Recommend to everyone. You won't regret it. Will do it again

Tired of the stodgy, old school, wood panelled room, typical Chicago steakhouse? Not that there is anything wrong with those. But if you‚Äôre in the mood for a different more French bistro, ideal for date night vibe while still being upscale - look no further.

column3: Eat here,date night or couples. Delicious and unpretentious. High-end restaurant
column4: Great,hip,swanky and original steak and seafood place. Make reservations well in advance. I‚Äôve never had a bad meal.
My his and I had a fantastic dinner at Bavettes! Our steak, shrimp, and drinks were delicious. Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!
The decor is just beyond.. and the food is utterly divine!. Bread is to die for -- and service is impeccable. !
The restaurant is lightly dimmed which sets a great mood. Steaks are phenomenal. Best Bone Marrow in the city. Great selection of wine.

Most people in Chicago head to Gibsons when they think "red meat; big steaks". For our money, we'd choose Bavette's any time. It's cozier, friendlier and we feel appreciated. And when you're spending this kind of money, that's nice!

Once you have their special prime steak, you may never buy a steak at the market. It was large enough to share with one other. We love this place but it is a hard reservation so you need to plan ahead. Worth the planning!
Great vibe .... bustling yet cozy! The food is excellent! It has a super friendly and accommodating staff! It is now a new favorite restaurant! Great date spot!
I picked this place after reading reviews here. I must say that they was not lying. Bavette‚Äôs Is my new favorite place in Chicago. Great service and wonderful food.

We had a phenomenal meal with top notch drinks. The seafood platter was divine. The service was excellent, and the setting was sophisticated yet comfortable. One of my favourite restaurants in Chicago.

Without a reservation, they were still able to squeeze us in. The service is outstanding. The best service we've ever had in a restaurant. Ever. The wine and steak were delicious. My husband still talks about this steak. Worth the trip.

OMG. LOVE. LOVE. LOVE. SEAFOOD TOWER! Great cocktails! Very fine beef! We spent three hours gorging ourselves. Totally amazing everything! Service is stellar! Ambience is gorgeous! Can we move in please??

Food was very fresh and high quality. Service was excellent, as was ambience. Only negative was price of 12 oysters $42 is just gouging guests. No price on menu for oysters so beware....perhaps I missed the pearl.

This restaurant is amazing! The service is wonderful, the food is delicious, and the ambiance is great! The Shrimp de Jonghe appetizer was awesome and you can't go wrong with any of their steaks! Definitely worth a visit!

It can be overlooked because it is ‚Äúnot super trendy‚Äú. You can have a warm quiet dinner with great staff and even better GM Complementary house made lemon cello recipe was fun to compare with my blend and San Marcos from Positano Try It!
High-end steak and seafood. Excellent all around. My favorite dish is the king crab and Brussels sprouts on the side. Try the cocktails.
Great place for a date or customer dinner. Food and drinks are outstanding. Service is he one of the best in Chicago.

We had a late lunch with excellent service. The food took a little longer than expected but I believe it was during a shift change from lunch to dinner service. White tablecloth, very consistent food and service. It‚Äôs a great Chicago welcome home feel.

I have no reluctance to say that the bone-in rib eye is the BEST steak in Chicago. Expensive but big enough to share, the salads, seafood, appetizers, and desserts are terrific. Sit downstairs‚Äîthe main floor dining room gets quite noisy.

Service was friendly and knowledgeable. Food was good, but I expected better given the reviews and prices. If you're hungry be sure to order more than just an entree. If you go after 10 on a weekday you most likely won't need a reservation.
Bavette's is probably my favorite restaurants in Chicago. Elegant and cozy with some amazing food and excellent cocktails.
This restaurant never disappoints, from the drinks to the service to the meal, always amazing! Their rib eye is by far the best I've ever eaten. Hands down my favorite restaurant in Chicago!
Such an amazing place. Sexy atmosphere, delicious food, drink nirvana, great music. Perfect date night spot.
Steaks were tremendous. Sides were very good. Service was excellent and knowledgeable. Got light dessert due to volume of food, so hard to review. Tables are very close to each other.
I love the steak frittes, surprising reasonable price and great steak with flavored salt, great fries and dipping sauce. I've also had the stroganoff and the chicken and both were excellent.

Totally full. People everywhere. Great atmosphere. Sat while waiting in mini lounge area just inside. Service suffering due to pace - many asks to get a second bar order. But steak excellent and accompanied by good value Zin from Dashe.
